translated: In a solitary place free from people, on top of a fire, he should visualize the wind maṇḍala in the center of the water maṇḍala.

original: de'i steng du chu'i dkyil 'khor zlum po la padma 'dab brgyad bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du chu'i dkyil 'khor zlum po la padma 'dab brgyad bri bar bya'o //
translated: On top of that, one should draw a round water maṇḍala with eight lotus petals.

original: de'i dbus su lto 'phye mkha' 'gro la gnas pa'i chu lha skyes bu'i gdong la sprul mgo bdun gyi gdengs ka yod pa /
analyzed: de'i dbus su lto 'phye mkha' 'gro la gnas pa'i chu lha skyes bu'i gdong la sprul mgo bdun gyi gdengs ka yod pa /
translated: In the center of that, one should draw Varuṇa, the water god, who is situated on a kumbhāṇḍa and a ḍākinī, with a human face and the hood of seven snake heads.

original: zhabs klu gcig pa /
analyzed: zhabs klu gcig pa /
translated: He has one leg,

original: sprul gyi zhags pa 'phen pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: sprul gyi zhags pa 'phen pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: and he is drawing a snake noose.

original: shar gyi 'dab ma la mtha' yas ljang gu /🔽lho'i 'dab ma la nor rgyas dkar po /
analyzed: shar gyi 'dab ma la mtha' yas ljang gu / lho'i 'dab ma la nor rgyas dkar po /
translated: One should draw Ananta, who is green, on the eastern petal.🔽One should draw Vāsuki, who is white, on the southern petal.

original: nub kyi 'dab ma la 'jog po dmar po /
analyzed: nub kyi 'dab ma la 'jog po dmar po /
translated: One should draw Takṣaka, who is red, on the western petal.

original: byang gi 'dab ma la karko ta nag po //
analyzed: byang gi 'dab ma la karko ta nag po //
translated: One should draw Karkoṭa, who is black, on the northern petal.

original: me'i mtshams kyi 'dab ma la padma dkar po //
analyzed: me'i mtshams kyi 'dab ma la padma dkar po //
translated: One should draw Padma, who is white, on the petal in the southeast.

original: bden bral gyi 'dab ma la padma chen po dkar po /🔽rlung mtshams kyi 'dab ma la dung skyong ser po //
analyzed: bden bral gyi 'dab ma la padma chen po dkar po / rlung mtshams kyi 'dab ma la dung skyong ser po //
translated: One should draw Mahāpadma, who is white, on the petal in the southwest.🔽One should draw Śaṅkhapāla, who is yellow, on the petal in the northwest.

original: dbang ldan gyi 'dab ma la rigs ldan kha dog sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan gyi 'dab ma la rigs ldan kha dog sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: One should draw Kulika, who is multicolored, on the petal in the northeast.

original: de ltar klu'i dkyil 'khor @81a * //
analyzed: de ltar klu'i dkyil 'khor @81a * //
translated: In this way, one should draw the maṇḍala of the nāgas.

original: bris nas // yi ge nam gyis ji skad bshad pa'i cho gas klu bsams la rdza'i bar du bcug pa'i nam gyis bkug la rang rang gi gnas la thim par byas nas /
analyzed: bris nas // yi ge nam gyis ji skad bshad pa'i cho gas klu bsams la rdza'i bar du bcug pa'i nam gyis bkug la rang rang gi gnas la thim par byas nas /
translated: Having written it, one should summon the nāgas with the mantra NAM, and having caused them to enter the vase, one should cause them to dissolve into their respective places.

original: sngo zhing bska ba 'o ma dang / bu ram la sogs pa klu la 'os pa'i lha bshos kyis yang dag par mchod nas ji skad du smras pa'o //
analyzed: sngo zhing bska ba 'o ma dang / bu ram la sogs pa klu la 'os pa'i lha bshos kyis yang dag par mchod nas ji skad du smras pa'o //
translated: Then, having made a proper offering to the nāgas of green, astringent milk, molasses, and so forth, which are suitable for the nāgas, one should say,🔽 You great nāgas, please be pleased with me and cause the rain to fall in accordance with the word of the Blessed One.

original: klu chen po khyed rnams kyis bdag la yang dag par dga' ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' bzhin du char gyi rgyun dbab tu gsol zhes brjod nas klu rnams kyi char 'bebs par bsam zhing bzlas brjod byas na char 'bab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: klu chen po khyed rnams kyis bdag la yang dag par dga' ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' bzhin du char gyi rgyun dbab tu gsol zhes brjod nas klu rnams kyi char 'bebs par bsam zhing bzlas brjod byas na char 'bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites the mantra while imagining the nāgas causing rain to fall, it will rain.

original: des kyang ma phebs na ham ljang gu zlum po la stobs po che de bzhin du bris la /
analyzed: des kyang ma phebs na ham ljang gu zlum po la stobs po che de bzhin du bris la /
translated: If it still does not rain, one should write the syllable HAM, green in color and round, and Mahābala in the same way.

original: spyan drangs la 'og nas bshad pa'i cho gas sbyin sreg bya ste /
analyzed: spyan drangs la 'og nas bshad pa'i cho gas sbyin sreg bya ste /
translated: Having invited them, one should perform the homa rite as explained below.

original: klu thams cad kyi lce'i dkyil du yi ge nam bkod la bsang gtor la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba bu ram dang / 'o ma dang mar gyis bkang ba'i sreg blugs gsum gsum byin la /
analyzed: klu thams cad kyi lce'i dkyil du yi ge nam bkod la bsang gtor la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba bu ram dang / 'o ma dang mar gyis bkang ba'i sreg blugs gsum gsum byin la /
translated: Having placed the syllable nam in the middle of the tongues of all the nāgas, and having performed the preliminary rites such as the oblation, offer three oblations of molasses, milk, and ghee.

original: de nas 'o ma la sogs pas ci 'dod pa'i sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: de nas 'o ma la sogs pas ci 'dod pa'i sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Then perform a fire sacrifice of milk, etc., as desired.

original: de nas tshim pas char 'bebs par byed do //
analyzed: de nas tshim pas char 'bebs par byed do //
translated: Then, by satisfying them, they will cause rain to fall.

original: des kyang ma phebs na mngon spyod bya ste /
analyzed: des kyang ma phebs na mngon spyod bya ste /
translated: If they still do not bring rain, one should perform the rite of assault.

original: thams cad du nag po'i stobs po che'i rnal 'byor byas la /
analyzed: thams cad du nag po'i stobs po che'i rnal 'byor byas la /
translated: In all cases, one should perform the yoga of Mahābala the dark one.

original: bal mi kha'i sa dang ; chu dogs gnyis kyis dang / bshang ba dang gcin du bsres pas sprus la klu'i gzugs brnyan mtho gsum pa byas la dur khrod kyi sa la dug dang rnams dang khrag dang ske tshe dang / lan tshva dang / yungs mar gyis ral gri'i 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa bris pa la de'i steng du padma 'dab ma brgyad pa la klu brgyad kyi khyad par gyi snying po'am /
analyzed: bal mi kha'i sa dang ; chu dogs gnyis kyis dang / bshang ba dang gcin du bsres pas sprus la klu'i gzugs brnyan mtho gsum pa byas la dur khrod kyi sa la dug dang rnams dang khrag dang ske tshe dang / lan tshva dang / yungs mar gyis ral gri'i 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa bris pa la de'i steng du padma 'dab ma brgyad pa la klu brgyad kyi khyad par gyi snying po'am /
translated: Mix it with the earth and water of a Nepalese border region, and with feces and urine. Make an effigy of the naga king, three cubits high. On a charnel ground, draw an eight-spoked sword wheel with poison, blood, black mustard seed, salt, and sesame oil. On top of that, draw an eight-petaled lotus with the distinctive hearts of the eight nāgas.🔽

original: yang na spyi'i snying po bris nas dbus su chu lha'i snying po bris la bkug nas gzugs brnyan de'i snying gar bcug la yan lag thams cad tsha ba gsum dang ske tshe la sogs pas byugs la me la bdugs la sngags brjod par byas na char 'bebs par
analyzed: yang na spyi'i snying po bris nas dbus su chu lha'i snying po bris la bkug nas gzugs brnyan de'i snying gar bcug la yan lag thams cad tsha ba gsum dang ske tshe la sogs pas byugs la me la bdugs la sngags brjod par byas na char 'bebs par
translated: Mix together the earth of a Nepalese person's house and the earth and water of a riverbank, and mix in feces and urine. Make an effigy of a nāga three fingerbreadths high, and on a charnel ground's earth, draw with poison, blood, black mustard seed, salt, and black mustard oil an eight-spoked wheel of a sword. On top of that, draw an eight-petaled lotus with the distinctive essence of the eight nāgas, or else draw the general essence. In the center, write the essence of Varuṇa. Summon [the nāga], and having inserted it into the heart of that effigy, fumigate all the limbs with the three hot things, black mustard seed, and so forth, and recite the mantra.

original: byed do // des kyang ma phebs na gong ma ltar sa la klu'i dkyil 'khor bris te /
analyzed: byed do // des kyang ma phebs na gong ma ltar sa la klu'i dkyil 'khor bris te /
translated: If it does not rain, then as before, draw the nāga maṇḍala on the ground.

original: stod g-yogs dang se'u ka sngon po bgo ba'am gos dmar po bgo ba'am /
analyzed: stod g-yogs dang se'u ka sngon po bgo ba'am gos dmar po bgo ba'am /
translated: One should wear an upper garment and blue trousers, or red garments,

original: yang na gcer bur byung ste /
analyzed: yang na gcer bur byung ste /
translated: or else one should appear naked.🔽One should imagine that the blazing sun is marked with a vajra, and that the nāga circle is located in the center of the left foot, and that the nāga is facing upward, and that it is pressed down by the foot, and that it is frightened, and that the hood is facing upward, and that the nāga is called “phu,” and that it pervades the sky, and that it vomits blood and causes rain, and that it is made into an ocean.

original: nyi ma 'bar ba la gnas @81b ba'i rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs pa'i rkang pa g-yon pa'i dkyil la gnas pa'i klu'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i klu kha gnam la bltas pa mnan pa dang / skrag ste gdengs ka gdengs pa kha gyen du bltas pa phu zhes bya bas nam mkha' khyab cing khrag skyugs shing char 'bebs pas rgya mtshor byed par bsams nas tshig re re'i mthar rnams dang spel ba'i sngags bzla bar bya ste /
analyzed: nyi ma 'bar ba la gnas @81b ba'i rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs pa'i rkang pa g-yon pa'i dkyil la gnas pa'i klu'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i klu kha gnam la bltas pa mnan pa dang / skrag ste gdengs ka gdengs pa kha gyen du bltas pa phu zhes bya bas nam mkha' khyab cing khrag skyugs shing char 'bebs pas rgya mtshor byed par bsams nas tshig re re'i mthar rnams dang spel ba'i sngags bzla bar bya ste /
translated: Then one should recite the mantra, adding “namaḥ” at the end of each line.

original: des na char 'bebs par byed do //
analyzed: des na char 'bebs par byed do //
translated: Then it will rain.

original: des kyang ma phebs na me thab gru gsum byas la de'i dbus su stobs po che bsams nas /
analyzed: des kyang ma phebs na me thab gru gsum byas la de'i dbus su stobs po che bsams nas /
translated: If it does not rain even by that, one should make a triangular hearth, and imagine Mahābala in its center.

original: gdol pa'i khyim nas blangs pa'i me sbar la /
analyzed: gdol pa'i khyim nas blangs pa'i me sbar la /
translated: One should light a fire with sticks obtained from a caṇḍāla’s house.

original: klu'i gzugs brnyan dug dang lan tshva dang / da du ra dang / ske tshe la byas la phus bskyed la /
analyzed: klu'i gzugs brnyan dug dang lan tshva dang / da du ra dang / ske tshe la byas la phus bskyed la /
translated: mustard seed, and black sesame seeds.

original: phreng ba'i sngags bzla zhing lag pa g-yon pas mjug ma'i rtse mo nas brtsams pa /
analyzed: phreng ba'i sngags bzla zhing lag pa g-yon pas mjug ma'i rtse mo nas brtsams pa /
translated: Recite the garland mantra, and with the left hand, beginning from the tip of the tail,

original: bshang ba dang gci bas lus byugs la gtub cing gtub cing sbyin sreg brgya rtsa brgyad byas na des char 'bebs par byed do //
analyzed: bshang ba dang gci bas lus byugs la gtub cing gtub cing sbyin sreg brgya rtsa brgyad byas na des char 'bebs par byed do //
translated: cut up the effigy smeared with feces and urine, and make one hundred and eight burnt offerings.

original: des kyang ma phebs na nyes pa 'di ni stobs po che'i yin no zhes te /
analyzed: des kyang ma phebs na nyes pa 'di ni stobs po che'i yin no zhes te /
translated: If it does not rain, then it is the fault of Mahābala.🔽One should say, “This is the fault of Mahābala.”

original: gong du gsungs pa'i rdzas kyis stobs po che'i gzugs brnyan byas la /
analyzed: gong du gsungs pa'i rdzas kyis stobs po che'i gzugs brnyan byas la /
translated: Make an effigy of Mahābala from the substances mentioned above.

original: bdag dpal gnod mdzes kyi sbyor ba dang ldan pas dgug du 'gro bas gong ma ltar gan rkyal du rkang pa g-yon pas mnan la /
analyzed: bdag dpal gnod mdzes kyi sbyor ba dang ldan pas dgug du 'gro bas gong ma ltar gan rkyal du rkang pa g-yon pas mnan la /
translated: With the practice of glorious Ucchuṣma, summon him, and as before, lie down supine with the left foot pressing down on him.

original: ma h'a ba la barsha pa ya shr'i ghram zhes bya ba'i bskul tshig dang ldan pa'i h'um bzhi dang gnod mdzes rgyal po'i sngags bzlas brjod khri bya'o //
analyzed: ma h'a ba la barsha pa ya shr'i ghram zhes bya ba'i bskul tshig dang ldan pa'i h'um bzhi dang gnod mdzes rgyal po'i sngags bzlas brjod khri bya'o //
translated: One should recite the mantra of the four hūṃs and the king of the fierce ones, along with the exhortation “Mahābala, shower down rain!” and the mantra of the king of the fierce ones, ten thousand times.

original: de nas mngon spyod kyi hom khung la khro bo'i rgyal po gnod mdzes zhal gdangs pa'i yi ge h'um gi ljags dang ldan par bsams nas /
analyzed: de nas mngon spyod kyi hom khung la khro bo'i rgyal po gnod mdzes zhal gdangs pa'i yi ge h'um gi ljags dang ldan par bsams nas /
translated: Then, in the pit for the fierce burnt offering, one should imagine the king of the fierce ones with a gaping mouth and a tongue marked with the syllable hūṃ.

original: de'i gzugs brnyan gtub cing de'i zhal du sbyin sreg khri phrag gcig bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gzugs brnyan gtub cing de'i zhal du sbyin sreg khri phrag gcig bya'o //
translated: One should cut up an effigy of the one who is to be subdued and offer it into his mouth in a burnt offering of ten thousand oblations.

original: de nas stobs po che char 'bebs par byed do zhes rnal 'byor gyi tshul thams cad las rab tu grags so //🔽de nas klu thams cad dang stobs po che'i zhi bar bya ba'i me thab zlum po la gnas pa'i spyan ma zhi ba'i zhal du ste /
analyzed: de nas stobs po che char 'bebs par byed do zhes rnal 'byor gyi tshul thams cad las rab tu grags so // de nas klu thams cad dang stobs po che'i zhi bar bya ba'i me thab zlum po la gnas pa'i spyan ma zhi ba'i zhal du ste /
translated: Then Mahābala will cause rain to fall. This is well known in all the traditions of yoga.🔽Then, for the pacification of all the nāgas and Mahābala, one should offer ten thousand oblations of ghee, milk, and so forth, in the mouth of Pāṇḍarā, who has a peaceful face, and who abides in the round hearth for the pacification.

original: sngags dang chogs mar dang 'o ma la sogs pa'i sreg blugs khri phul bas de rnams zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngags dang chogs mar dang 'o ma la sogs pa'i sreg blugs khri phul bas de rnams zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By this, they will be pacified.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das ma 'di la //
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das ma 'di la //
translated: Therefore, this Blessed Lady

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi zhing 'byung ba //🔽zhes bya'o // 'dod pa'i rgyal @82a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi zhing 'byung ba // zhes bya'o // 'dod pa'i rgyal @82a * //
translated: is the source of the field of all Buddhas.

original: pos dgug pa'i cho ga gsungs pa /
analyzed: pos dgug pa'i cho ga gsungs pa /
translated: The rite of summoning the king of love is taught:

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, etc.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the yoga of Vajrasattva,

original: zhes pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' las gyur pa'i 'dod pa'i rgyal po'i sbyor bas /
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' las gyur pa'i 'dod pa'i rgyal po'i sbyor bas /
translated: means by the yoga of the king of love arisen from Vajrasattva.

original: dgug par bya ba'i gzugs brnyan gshin rje gshed kyi cho ga las gsungs pa bzhin du byas nas bkug ste thod par bcug nas thod pa de g-yon brkyang pa'i g-yas pa'i rkang pas mnan nas 'dod pa'i rgyal po'i sngags spel ba dang bcas par bzlas brjod byas na
analyzed: dgug par bya ba'i gzugs brnyan gshin rje gshed kyi cho ga las gsungs pa bzhin du byas nas bkug ste thod par bcug nas thod pa de g-yon brkyang pa'i g-yas pa'i rkang pas mnan nas 'dod pa'i rgyal po'i sngags spel ba dang bcas par bzlas brjod byas na
translated: Having summoned the image of the one to be summoned according to the rite of Yamantaka, having placed it in a skull cup, having pressed down on the skull cup with the right foot extended to the left, having repeated the mantra of the king of love with the augment,

original: gong ma ltar /
analyzed: gong ma ltar /
translated: as above,

original: rdo rje lcags kyus 'gugs par 'gyur //
analyzed: rdo rje lcags kyus 'gugs par 'gyur //
translated: the vajra hook summons.

original: zhes so // mi g-yo mgon pos lha chen chung ma dang bcas pa dgug pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // mi g-yo mgon pos lha chen chung ma dang bcas pa dgug pa gsungs pa /
translated: Acala teaches the summoning of the great god with his wife:

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, etc.

original: lha rnams 'khor dang bcas pa ni de'i dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: lha rnams 'khor dang bcas pa ni de'i dgug par bya'o //
translated: The gods together with their retinue are summoned by that.

original: khro bo'i rgyal po sngags 'di yis //
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po sngags 'di yis //
translated: With this mantra of the King of Wrath

original: zhes pa ni mi g-yo mgon po'i rnal 'byor pas skyes pa'i thod pa skyon med pa blangs nas /🔽de la rkang pa g-yas pa'i sor mo'i khrag dang ldan tshva dang / yungs mar dang ske tshe la sogs pa'i lha chen po chung ma dang bcas pa'i 'am /
analyzed: zhes pa ni mi g-yo mgon po'i rnal 'byor pas skyes pa'i thod pa skyon med pa blangs nas / de la rkang pa g-yas pa'i sor mo'i khrag dang ldan tshva dang / yungs mar dang ske tshe la sogs pa'i lha chen po chung ma dang bcas pa'i 'am /
translated: The yogin of Acala takes an undamaged human skull,🔽and in it he draws with the blood of the toes of his right foot, salt, mustard oil, black mustard seed, and so forth, the image of Maheśvara together with his wife,

original: lha ma yin la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan bris la dgug par bya ste /
analyzed: lha ma yin la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan bris la dgug par bya ste /
translated: or of the asura and so forth.

original: thod pa de rkang pa g-yas pas mnan nas snga ma bzhin du lcags kyus 'gugs par bsams la bskul ba dang bcas par sngags bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: thod pa de rkang pa g-yas pas mnan nas snga ma bzhin du lcags kyus 'gugs par bsams la bskul ba dang bcas par sngags bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Having pressed down the skull with his right foot, he visualizes the summoning with the hook as before, and he should recite the mantra together with the urging.

original: de nas mthu chen po dang ldan pa dag kyang skrag par gyur nas /
analyzed: de nas mthu chen po dang ldan pa dag kyang skrag par gyur nas /
translated: Then even those of great power become frightened,

original: kha sbyar lus su bcas par 'gugs //
analyzed: kha sbyar lus su bcas par 'gugs //
translated: and they are summoned with their mouths and bodies joined.

original: zhes chung ma dang bcas pa 'ong bar 'gyur zhes so //
analyzed: zhes chung ma dang bcas pa 'ong bar 'gyur zhes so //
translated: Thus they come together with their wives.

original: gnod mdzes kyi bu mo dgug pa'i cho ga gsungs pa /
analyzed: gnod mdzes kyi bu mo dgug pa'i cho ga gsungs pa /
translated: The rite of summoning the daughter of Sumbha is stated.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, etc.🔽All the powerful daughters, etc.

original: bu mo mthu chen thams cad ces pa ni klu dang lha ma yin la sogs pa'i bu mo 'dod chags kyis yid g-yos pas skra bshig gos dang bral bar gyur nas rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: bu mo mthu chen thams cad ces pa ni klu dang lha ma yin la sogs pa'i bu mo 'dod chags kyis yid g-yos pas skra bshig gos dang bral bar gyur nas rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
translated: The daughters of the nagas, titans, etc., their minds agitated by passion, their hair disheveled, and naked, remember Vajrasattva,

original: mi bskyod pa rjes su dran pas 'dod pa rnyed par gyur to zhes so //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa rjes su dran pas 'dod pa rnyed par gyur to zhes so //
translated: and thus attain their desire.

original: las gsungs pa rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: las gsungs pa rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The rite is stated: Vajrasattva, etc.

original: de yang rdo rje sems dpa' las byung ba'i gnod mdzes rgyal po'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas mtshan ma dang ldan pa'i bud med kyi thod par bsgrub par bya ba'i @82b rkang pa g-yon pa'i srin lag gi khrag gis bris la de padma la zhabs g-yon bas mnan
analyzed: de yang rdo rje sems dpa' las byung ba'i gnod mdzes rgyal po'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas mtshan ma dang ldan pa'i bud med kyi thod par bsgrub par bya ba'i @82b rkang pa g-yon pa'i srin lag gi khrag gis bris la de padma la zhabs g-yon bas mnan
translated: Moreover, one should write the name of the victim with the blood of the ring finger of the left foot on a human skull endowed with signs, by the yoga of Sumbharaja born from Vajrasattva, and place it under the left foot on a lotus.

original: te / gong ma ltar de bzhin gshegs pa kun gnod mdzes su sprul pa'i lcags kyus snying gar brgyab la /
analyzed: te / gong ma ltar de bzhin gshegs pa kun gnod mdzes su sprul pa'i lcags kyus snying gar brgyab la /
translated: As above, the Tathagatas emanate as Yamantakrsna, and strike the heart with the hook.

original: zhags pas ske nas bcings la /
analyzed: zhags pas ske nas bcings la /
translated: Binding the neck with the noose,

original: phreng ba'i sngags tshig re re 'am bskul ba'i tshig dang bcas par bzlas shing dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: phreng ba'i sngags tshig re re 'am bskul ba'i tshig dang bcas par bzlas shing dgug par bya'o //
translated: one should summon with the mantra of the rosary, each syllable, or with the words of invocation.

original: de nas bu mo rnams 'gugs so //
analyzed: de nas bu mo rnams 'gugs so //
translated: Then the girls are summoned.

original: zhes so // bsgrub bya'i sems 'gog pas na tshar gcod pa ste de bas na mngon spyod kyi nang du 'dus pas na phat ces bya ba de ma bor yang nyes pa med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes so // bsgrub bya'i sems 'gog pas na tshar gcod pa ste de bas na mngon spyod kyi nang du 'dus pas na phat ces bya ba de ma bor yang nyes pa med pa'o //
translated: Since the mind of the victim is stopped, it is subjugation, and since it is included in the wrathful, there is no fault in not uttering the phat.

original: de ltar sngags rgyud dang ldan pa'i las gsungs nas /
analyzed: de ltar sngags rgyud dang ldan pa'i las gsungs nas /
translated: Having explained the action endowed with mantra and tantra,

original: da ni bsam gtan las skyes pa'i dgug pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni bsam gtan las skyes pa'i dgug pa gsungs pa /
translated: now, the summoning born of concentration is explained.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, etc.

original: dam tshig chen po ni sems dpa' de kho na nyid de /
analyzed: dam tshig chen po ni sems dpa' de kho na nyid de /
translated: The great commitment is the reality of the hero.

original: de'i 'byung ba gang dbyer med pa gang las gyur pa de la rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rnam pa lta bur snyoms par zhugs nas zhes so ;
analyzed: de'i 'byung ba gang dbyer med pa gang las gyur pa de la rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rnam pa lta bur snyoms par zhugs nas zhes so ;
translated: The one who is in union with the vajra-holder aspect, from the indivisibility of whose elements this arises,

original: / dam tshig chen po'i ni sems dpa'o //
analyzed: / dam tshig chen po'i ni sems dpa'o //
translated: is the great commitment being.

original: de'i rdo rje gsum gyi gsang ba'i ni sku la sogs pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de'i rdo rje gsum gyi gsang ba'i ni sku la sogs pa gsum mo //
translated: The secret of his three vajras is his three bodies, and so on.

original: de rnams la bshad pa'i chos ni gsung kho na mi 'da' bas na dam tshig ste /
analyzed: de rnams la bshad pa'i chos ni gsung kho na mi 'da' bas na dam tshig ste /
translated: The Dharma that is explained in them is his speech alone, because it is not transgressed.

original: de'i tshig ni phyung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i tshig ni phyung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The commitment is his word, which is emitted.

original: sangs rgyas rdo rje ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdo rje ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The vajra of the buddhas is Akshobhya.

original: de'i sku gsum la rdo rje sems dpa' rnam par bsgoms te ji lta ba bzhin du 'khor lo dang ldan par bsgoms nas /
analyzed: de'i sku gsum la rdo rje sems dpa' rnam par bsgoms te ji lta ba bzhin du 'khor lo dang ldan par bsgoms nas /
translated: Having meditated on Vajrasattva in his three bodies, as before, having meditated on him as endowed with the wheel,🔽he emits the deities marked with the noose and vajra hook from his heart.

original: de rang gi snying ga nas zhags pa dang rdo rje kyo bas mtshan pa'i lha rnams spros pas ji snyed sangs rgyas rnams kyang 'gugs pa'o zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de rang gi snying ga nas zhags pa dang rdo rje kyo bas mtshan pa'i lha rnams spros pas ji snyed sangs rgyas rnams kyang 'gugs pa'o zhes sbyar ro //
translated: As many buddhas as there are are summoned by the hook.

original: sangs rgyas kun ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: All buddhas are Vairochana.

original: gsung ni snang ba mtha' yas so //
analyzed: gsung ni snang ba mtha' yas so //
translated: The speech is Amitābha.

original: de gnyis sbyor ba gzhan gyis 'khor lo chen po sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: de gnyis sbyor ba gzhan gyis 'khor lo chen po sbyor ba yis //
translated: The union of those two is the great wheel, by the union with another.

original: zhes te / lha'i 'khor lo dang ldan par bsams nas gong ma ltar sbyar bas ji snyed pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' yang 'gugs par 'gyur zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes te / lha'i 'khor lo dang ldan par bsams nas gong ma ltar sbyar bas ji snyed pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' yang 'gugs par 'gyur zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Having imagined the wheel of the deity, one should unite as above. By that, even Vajrasattva, however much, is summoned.

original: de'i mjug sdud pa gsungs pa /🔽mi phyed ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mjug sdud pa gsungs pa / mi phyed ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The conclusion of that is stated:

original: mi phyed rdo rje gsum bsgoms pas //
analyzed: mi phyed rdo rje gsum bsgoms pas //
translated: The three vajras are indivisible,

original: zhes pa ni de rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pa ste kyo ba'i gnas so //🔽'khor lo padmo rdo rje che //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pa ste kyo ba'i gnas so // 'khor lo padmo rdo rje che //
translated: by meditating on those, one is consecrated, and that is the hook-site.🔽The wheel, lotus, and great vajra,

original: rdo rje kyo ba'i khyad par gyis //🔽zhes pa ni sku'i skabs su 'phros pa'i lha zhags @83a * //
analyzed: rdo rje kyo ba'i khyad par gyis // zhes pa ni sku'i skabs su 'phros pa'i lha zhags @83a * //
translated: by the hook of the vajra,

original: pa dang lcags kyus mtshan pa ni 'khor lo'i kyo ba ste gzhan gnyis kyang de ltar ro //
analyzed: pa dang lcags kyus mtshan pa ni 'khor lo'i kyo ba ste gzhan gnyis kyang de ltar ro //
translated: The wheel hook is marked with a noose and hook, as explained in the context of the body. The other two are also like that.

original: des sngags rnams te lha rnams kyang 'gugs par 'gyur zhes so //
analyzed: des sngags rnams te lha rnams kyang 'gugs par 'gyur zhes so //
translated: By that, even the mantras, that is, the deities, are summoned.

original: rdo rje gsum gyi 'khor los dgug pa bshad nas lha gzhan gyi rnal 'byor pas 'khor lo 'am gcig pas dgug pa gsungs pa /🔽thams cad ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum gyi 'khor los dgug pa bshad nas lha gzhan gyi rnal 'byor pas 'khor lo 'am gcig pas dgug pa gsungs pa / thams cad ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Having explained the summoning with the wheel of the three vajras, it teaches the summoning with the wheel or with one by a yogin of another deity.🔽All vajras, etc.

original: thams cad rdo rje ste lha thams cad do //
analyzed: thams cad rdo rje ste lha thams cad do //
translated: All vajras are all deities.

original: de nyid dngos po ni zhi ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid dngos po ni zhi ba'o //
translated: That itself is the entity, i.e., the peace.

original: de yang rang sngags skyes bu ste rang gi 'dod pa'i lha rang gi sngags las 'khor lo dang ldan pa re re yin yang rung ste bskyed nas rdo rje gsum gyi byin gyis brlabs la /
analyzed: de yang rang sngags skyes bu ste rang gi 'dod pa'i lha rang gi sngags las 'khor lo dang ldan pa re re yin yang rung ste bskyed nas rdo rje gsum gyi byin gyis brlabs la /
translated: Moreover, the person born from one’s mantra, i.e., one’s desired deity, is born from one’s mantra, and is endowed with a wheel. Having generated that, one should consecrate it with the three vajras.

original: de rnams las 'dod pa'i rgyal po la sogs pa lcags kyus mtshan ma'i lha 'phros pas mi'i bu mo la sogs pa'i snying gar rdo rje kyo ba'i sbyor bas 'gugs so zhes so //
analyzed: de rnams las 'dod pa'i rgyal po la sogs pa lcags kyus mtshan ma'i lha 'phros pas mi'i bu mo la sogs pa'i snying gar rdo rje kyo ba'i sbyor bas 'gugs so zhes so //
translated: From those, the king of desires, etc., the hook-marked deities emanate, and by the application of the vajra hook, they summon the human girl, etc., to the heart.

original: 'gugs pa thams cad kyi spyi'i cho ga gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'gugs pa thams cad kyi spyi'i cho ga gsungs pa /
translated: It teaches the general rite of all summoning.

original: rlung gi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rlung gi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Wind, etc.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni dgug par bya ba'i gdan du sbyor na nges par 'gugs zhes so //
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni dgug par bya ba'i gdan du sbyor na nges par 'gugs zhes so //
translated: The wind maṇḍala is to be connected with the seat of the one to be summoned, and will certainly summon is certain.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor de la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gcig bsam mo //
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor de la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gcig bsam mo //
translated: On that wind maṇḍala, one should imagine a moon maṇḍala.

original: de'i steng du bsgrub bya rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin bsam mo //
analyzed: de'i steng du bsgrub bya rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin bsam mo //
translated: On top of that, one should imagine the one to be summoned in the nature of Vairocana.

original: sha tsi zhes pa ni spyan ma dang m'a ma k'i sa zhi ba dang srung ba'i cho ga bzhin du stobs dbang pa dang bdud rtsi'i rgyun zags par bsams pas rdo rje mi 'chi ste /
analyzed: sha tsi zhes pa ni spyan ma dang m'a ma k'i sa zhi ba dang srung ba'i cho ga bzhin du stobs dbang pa dang bdud rtsi'i rgyun zags par bsams pas rdo rje mi 'chi ste /
translated: Śacī is Pṛthivī and Māmakī, and by imagining the stream of nectar falling in the rite of pacification and protection, there is the vajra of immortality.

original: skrag pa la sogs pa dang bral bas ni tshe ring por 'gyur ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: skrag pa la sogs pa dang bral bas ni tshe ring por 'gyur ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: By being free from fear and so forth, there is the yoga of longevity.

original: dgug pa'i sngags kyang brgya rtsa bcur brjod na gang yang rung ba nges par rtag tu 'gugs par 'gyur zhes so //
analyzed: dgug pa'i sngags kyang brgya rtsa bcur brjod na gang yang rung ba nges par rtag tu 'gugs par 'gyur zhes so //
translated: If one recites the summoning mantra one hundred and ten times, any one will certainly always be summoned.

original: 'dod pa'i rgyal pos nam mkha'i lha rnams kyi bu mo dgug pa gsungs pa //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rgyal pos nam mkha'i lha rnams kyi bu mo dgug pa gsungs pa //
translated: The king of desire taught the summoning of the celestial maidens of the sky.

original: rdo rje kyo ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje kyo ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The vajra hook and so forth.

original: rdo rje kyo ba ni lcags kyu ste //
analyzed: rdo rje kyo ba ni lcags kyu ste //
translated: The vajra hook is the goad.

original: des mtshan pa ni gzugs po che ste 'dod pa'i rgyal po'o //
analyzed: des mtshan pa ni gzugs po che ste 'dod pa'i rgyal po'o //
translated: The one marked with that is the great form, the king of desire.

original: de nyid gsungs pa la gnas pa 'bar ba rdo rje 'dra ba'i 'od zer lcags kyus mtshan pa spros pas rdo rje dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa la gnas pa 'bar ba rdo rje 'dra ba'i 'od zer lcags kyus mtshan pa spros pas rdo rje dkyil 'khor te /
translated: He himself is the vajra circle, blazing with the light of the vajra-like rays that are marked with hooks, by emitting them.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i nam mkha'i lha rnams kyi bu mo 'gugs pa'i mchog ces pa'o //
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i nam mkha'i lha rnams kyi bu mo 'gugs pa'i mchog ces pa'o //
translated: The supreme summoning of the daughters of the gods who dwell on the wind mandala.

original: gnod mdzes kyis lha ma yin gyi bu mo dgug pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: gnod mdzes kyis lha ma yin gyi bu mo dgug pa gsungs pa /
translated: Sumbha has declared the summoning of the daughters of the asuras.

original: rang gi zhes @83b ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi zhes @83b ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The verse begins, One's own.

original: sngags rang gi khro bor gyur cing 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pas na dam tshig ste /
analyzed: sngags rang gi khro bor gyur cing 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pas na dam tshig ste /
translated: The mantra is one's own wrathful one, and since it is not to be transgressed, it is the commitment.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: rdo rje sa 'og gnas pa dag / ces pa ni gnod mdzes rgyal po'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sa 'og gnas pa dag / ces pa ni gnod mdzes rgyal po'o //
translated: The one who dwells in the vajra underworld is Sumbharaja.

original: de yang gsum pa la gnas pa'i sh'u la dang rdo rje kyo bas mtshan pa'i lha spros pas gong ma ltar lha ma yin gyi bu mo rnams 'gugs par 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: de yang gsum pa la gnas pa'i sh'u la dang rdo rje kyo bas mtshan pa'i lha spros pas gong ma ltar lha ma yin gyi bu mo rnams 'gugs par 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: Moreover, the yogin who is in the third stage, by emanating the god marked with the vajra hook, as before, the celestial maiden is summoned.

original: yang lha gang yang rung ba'i rnal 'byor pas rdzas dang ldan pa'i dgug pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang lha gang yang rung ba'i rnal 'byor pas rdzas dang ldan pa'i dgug pa gsungs pa /
translated: Again, it is said that the yogin of any god should summon the substance-endowed one.

original: btsag ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: btsag ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The verse beginning vermilion and so on.

original: mtshan ma thob pa'i rnal 'byor pas btsag gam rdo rgyus la sogs rdo rje kyo ba dang lha'i sbyor bas bsgoms nas /🔽zla ba gzas zin pa'i tshe khar bcug la rdo rje gsum gyis brlabs nas de las byung ba'i lha rnams spros pas nam mkha'i khams bkang la yang dag par bsdus nas gnas brtag pa'i ngo bor chags par byas nas ji srid zla ba ma grol gyi bar du
analyzed: mtshan ma thob pa'i rnal 'byor pas btsag gam rdo rgyus la sogs rdo rje kyo ba dang lha'i sbyor bas bsgoms nas / zla ba gzas zin pa'i tshe khar bcug la rdo rje gsum gyis brlabs nas de las byung ba'i lha rnams spros pas nam mkha'i khams bkang la yang dag par bsdus nas gnas brtag pa'i ngo bor chags par byas nas ji srid zla ba ma grol gyi bar du
translated: The yogin who has attained the signs, having meditated on the vajra hook with vermilion, red chalk, and so on, by the yoga of the god,

original: bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom par bya'o //
translated: at the time of the lunar eclipse, he should place it in his mouth, bless it with the three vajras, emanate the gods arisen from that, fill the realm of space, and again gather them, and having made them into the nature of the abode, he should meditate for as long as the moon is not released.

original: des shing leb la sogs pa la tshangs pa la sogs pa gang gi ming bris pa rnams 'ong bar 'gyur zhes so //
analyzed: des shing leb la sogs pa la tshangs pa la sogs pa gang gi ming bris pa rnams 'ong bar 'gyur zhes so //
translated: By that, those named Brahma and so forth, written on a wooden tablet and so forth, will come.

original: 'jam pa'i rdo rje'i rnal 'byor pas gnod sbyin gyi bu mo dgug pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'jam pa'i rdo rje'i rnal 'byor pas gnod sbyin gyi bu mo dgug pa gsungs pa /
translated: The summoning of a yaksha girl by a yogi of Manjushri is stated:

original: rnam pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //🔽rnam pa'i mchog rnams te mtshan dang dpe byad thams cad dang ldan pa'i rdo rje 'jam dpal cho ga ji lta bas rab tu bsgoms la dgug par bya ba'i gnod sbyin mo'i mgo la khro bo gshin rje gshed rdo rje kyo ba dang ldan pa bskal pa'i sreg
analyzed: rnam pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o // rnam pa'i mchog rnams te mtshan dang dpe byad thams cad dang ldan pa'i rdo rje 'jam dpal cho ga ji lta bas rab tu bsgoms la dgug par bya ba'i gnod sbyin mo'i mgo la khro bo gshin rje gshed rdo rje kyo ba dang ldan pa bskal pa'i sreg
translated: The supreme aspects, and so forth.

original: pa chen po'i gzugs bsgoms nas /
analyzed: pa chen po'i gzugs bsgoms nas /
translated: The supreme aspects, endowed with all the signs and features, of Vajra Manjushri, having meditated just as prescribed, one should summon the yaksha girl, having meditated on the wrathful Yamantaka Vajra Hook on her head, the form of the great fire of the end of the eon,

original: de dang 'dra ba'i gzugs las spros pas kyang gnod sbyin mo dag bkug nas spyad par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i gzugs las spros pas kyang gnod sbyin mo dag bkug nas spyad par bya'o zhes so //
translated: and having emanated forms like that, one should summon the yaksha girls and enjoy them.

original: ji skad du //
analyzed: ji skad du //
translated: As it is said:

original: gnod sbyin mo yi sngags rgyud las //
analyzed: gnod sbyin mo yi sngags rgyud las //
translated: In the mantra tantra of the yaksha girls,

original: shin rje gshed kyi rnam par brtag / ces so //
analyzed: shin rje gshed kyi rnam par brtag / ces so //
translated: one should imagine Yamantaka.

original: gnod sbyin mo ni sra ba ste des gnon par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gnod sbyin mo ni sra ba ste des gnon par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The yakṣiṇī is the firm one, and she is pressed down by him.

original: rang rang gi lha'i cho gas las bya ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: rang rang gi lha'i cho gas las bya ba gsungs pa /
translated: It is said that the rite should be performed with the rite of one’s own deity.

original: kun gyi zhes pa la sogs pa'o /
analyzed: kun gyi zhes pa la sogs pa'o /
translated: [The verse] beginning with “of all” and so on.

original: kun gyi phyag rgya'i khyad par dang // zhes pa ni phyag rgya chen po'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: kun gyi phyag rgya'i khyad par dang // zhes pa ni phyag rgya chen po'i dbye bas so //
translated: “The distinction of all the mudrās” is by the division of the great seal.

original: sngags kyi khyad par thams cad kyis //
analyzed: sngags kyi khyad par thams cad kyis //
translated: “By all the distinctions of mantra”

original: zhes pa ni de'i bskyed pa dang dgug pa'i thabs su gsung gi //🔽lhag gzhan gyi phyag rgya dang @84a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de'i bskyed pa dang dgug pa'i thabs su gsung gi // lhag gzhan gyi phyag rgya dang @84a * //
translated: means that it is said to be the method of generating and summoning that.🔽“One should not summon with the mudrā and mantra of another deity”

original: sngags dang ldan pas lha gzhan gyi rnal 'byor gyis dgug par mi bya ste /
analyzed: sngags dang ldan pas lha gzhan gyi rnal 'byor gyis dgug par mi bya ste /
translated: means that one should not summon with the yoga of another deity by means of the mudrā and mantra of that [deity].

original: de ltar byas na sbyor ba po la rtog pa 'byung ste mi 'grub pas na bdag nyid 'jigs par 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: de ltar byas na sbyor ba po la rtog pa 'byung ste mi 'grub pas na bdag nyid 'jigs par 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: If one does so, the practitioner will have doubts and will not succeed, and so will be destroyed.

original: sbyor ba thams cad kyi thun mong gi cho ga gsungs pa /🔽rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba thams cad kyi thun mong gi cho ga gsungs pa / rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The common rite for all the rites is stated:🔽[The verse] beginning with “vajrasattva” and so on.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' rgyal po che //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' rgyal po che //
translated: “Vajrasattva, the great king”

original: zhes pa ni gnas bskyed pa sngon du 'gro ba'i ye shes lngas de'i sku dang ldan par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gnas bskyed pa sngon du 'gro ba'i ye shes lngas de'i sku dang ldan par bya'o //
translated: This is to say, having generated the abode, one should endow it with the body of the five intuitions.

original: de bar gyi srid pa 'jug pa la sogs pas 'od du zhu ste /
analyzed: de bar gyi srid pa 'jug pa la sogs pas 'od du zhu ste /
translated: Then, by the process of entering into the intermediate state of existence and so on, one should melt into light,

original: tshad med pa'i lha mor gyur pas de la yang dang yang du bskul bar bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: tshad med pa'i lha mor gyur pas de la yang dang yang du bskul bar bya'o zhes so //
translated: and again and again urge on the goddess of immeasurables who has arisen from that.

original: de las sngags kyi khyad par dang // phyag rgya chen po'i khyad par 'byung //
analyzed: de las sngags kyi khyad par dang // phyag rgya chen po'i khyad par 'byung //
translated: From that, the special mantra and the special great seal arise.

original: zhes so // ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: zhes so // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de nyid sngags rnams te lha thams cad kyi ston pa zhes te /
analyzed: de nyid sngags rnams te lha thams cad kyi ston pa zhes te /
translated: That itself is the mantra, the teacher of all gods,

original: gsal bar byed pa'i rgyan du rab tu brtag pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa'i rgyan du rab tu brtag pa'o zhes so //
translated: and is to be considered as the ornament that illuminates.

original: de'i rnam par dag pa ni thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba ste de mngon du gyur pa med na thams cad dag par 'gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam par dag pa ni thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba ste de mngon du gyur pa med na thams cad dag par 'gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its purity is the all-pervading, because without its manifestation, nothing would be pure.

original: da ni lha mo sgrol ma'i rnam grangs ral pa gcig ma zhes grangs pas de'i sbyor bas klu'i bu mo dgug pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni lha mo sgrol ma'i rnam grangs ral pa gcig ma zhes grangs pas de'i sbyor bas klu'i bu mo dgug pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, by the method of the goddess Tara, who is also called Ekajaṭī, the summoning of a nāga girl is taught.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, etc.

original: kun du rnam par sprul pa'i ye shes ni bya ba la nan tan gyi ye shes te mi phyed pa'i phyir na rdo rje lta bu ste /
analyzed: kun du rnam par sprul pa'i ye shes ni bya ba la nan tan gyi ye shes te mi phyed pa'i phyir na rdo rje lta bu ste /
translated: The gnosis of complete manifestation is the gnosis of earnest practice in action. It is like a vajra because it is indivisible.

original: don yod grub pa'i tshul gyis snyoms par zhugs nas zhes so //
analyzed: don yod grub pa'i tshul gyis snyoms par zhugs nas zhes so //
translated: Having entered into union with the manner of Amoghasiddhi, etc.

original: thor tshugs gcig ma ni ral pa gcig ma'o //
analyzed: thor tshugs gcig ma ni ral pa gcig ma'o //
translated: The single-crested one is the one-braided one.

original: dam tshig chen mo rgyal po ni don yod grub pa nyid pas na mchog ste mdud can ma'o //
analyzed: dam tshig chen mo rgyal po ni don yod grub pa nyid pas na mchog ste mdud can ma'o //
translated: The great queen of the pledge is the supreme one, Amoghasiddhi himself, the one with a topknot.

original: de yang sku dang zhal dbus ma sngo ba g-yas dkar ba g-yon dmar ba /
analyzed: de yang sku dang zhal dbus ma sngo ba g-yas dkar ba g-yon dmar ba /
translated: Moreover, her body and central face are blue, the right face is white, and the left face is red.

original: g-yas gnyis kyis gri gug dang ral gri 'dzin pa /
analyzed: g-yas gnyis kyis gri gug dang ral gri 'dzin pa /
translated: She holds a flaying knife and a sword with her two right hands.

original: g-yon gnyis nas thod pa dang rin po che bsnams pa dang po gnyis kyis thabs la 'khyud pa mche ba cu bzad gtsigs pa phyung po zhes so //
analyzed: g-yon gnyis nas thod pa dang rin po che bsnams pa dang po gnyis kyis thabs la 'khyud pa mche ba cu bzad gtsigs pa phyung po zhes so //
translated: She holds a skull cup and a jewel with her two left hands. She embraces the method with her first two hands. She bares her fangs and bares her teeth.

original: klu'i bu mo mthu chen ni 'dis dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: klu'i bu mo mthu chen ni 'dis dgug par bya'o //
translated: The powerful nāga girl is summoned by this.

original: bka' bzhin du ma byas na tshig par gyur cing gos dang bral nas bye ma 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: bka' bzhin du ma byas na tshig par gyur cing gos dang bral nas bye ma 'bab pa'o //
translated: If one does not act according to the word, one will be burned, and having become naked, one will be pelted with sand.

original: de don yod grub pa dran pa'i dam tshig la gnas na de med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas byang chub rjes su dran zhes so //
analyzed: de don yod grub pa dran pa'i dam tshig la gnas na de med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas byang chub rjes su dran zhes so //
translated: If one abides in the pledge of mindfulness of Amoghasiddhi, then because of that, one will be mindful of the enlightenment of the buddhas.

original: las gsungs pa /
analyzed: las gsungs pa /
translated: The rite is stated:

original: sngags @84b kyi rig pa 'di yis ni //
analyzed: sngags @84b kyi rig pa 'di yis ni //
translated: By this knowledge of the mantra,

original: zhes te / cho ga ji lta ba bzhin du ral gcig ma'i sbyor ba byas la /🔽rkang pa g-yon pa'i srin lag gi khrag dang n'a ga ge sar du bcas pas bud med kyi thod pa la rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i klu'i bu mo'i snying gar sngags spel ba dang bcas pa snga ma bzhin du bris nas bkug ste /
analyzed: zhes te / cho ga ji lta ba bzhin du ral gcig ma'i sbyor ba byas la / rkang pa g-yon pa'i srin lag gi khrag dang n'a ga ge sar du bcas pas bud med kyi thod pa la rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i klu'i bu mo'i snying gar sngags spel ba dang bcas pa snga ma bzhin du bris nas bkug ste /
translated: one should perform the yoga of Ekajaṭī according to the rite.🔽With blood from the ring finger of the left hand together with saffron, one should write the mantra with the repetition in the heart of the nāga girl on the wind maṇḍala in a woman’s skull. Having summoned her,

original: g-yas brkyang pa'i rkang pa g-yon bskum pas bskul ba dang ldan pa'i sngags brjod na klu rnams dang de'i bu mo mig bzangs dag kyang bkug nas nye bar spyad par bya zhes so //
analyzed: g-yas brkyang pa'i rkang pa g-yon bskum pas bskul ba dang ldan pa'i sngags brjod na klu rnams dang de'i bu mo mig bzangs dag kyang bkug nas nye bar spyad par bya zhes so //
translated: if one recites the mantra with the right leg extended and the left leg drawn in, the nāgas and their beautiful daughters will be summoned and one should enjoy them.

original: na bza' dkar mo'i rnam grangs khro gnyer ma zhes bya ba de'i sbyor ba rig 'dzin gyi bu mo dgug pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: na bza' dkar mo'i rnam grangs khro gnyer ma zhes bya ba de'i sbyor ba rig 'dzin gyi bu mo dgug pa gsungs pa /
translated: The procedure for summoning a knowledge-woman is taught in the section of the white-clad one called “Frowning One.”

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, etc.

original: nam mkha'i dam tshig ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dam tshig ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The pledge of space is the discriminating wisdom,

original: de'i 'byung ba gang dbyer med pas na rdo rje ste 'od dpag med kyi tshul gyis snyoms par zhugs nas zhes so //
analyzed: de'i 'byung ba gang dbyer med pas na rdo rje ste 'od dpag med kyi tshul gyis snyoms par zhugs nas zhes so //
translated: and since it is indivisible from the element, it is the vajra, and having entered into union in the manner of Amitābha, etc.

original: dam tshig chen po'i ste snang ba mtha' yas las mi 'da' bas te de nyid chos rdo rje khro gnyer ma ste phyag mtshan la sogs pa na bza' dkar mo dang 'dra ba la dmar skya'i mdog can /
analyzed: dam tshig chen po'i ste snang ba mtha' yas las mi 'da' bas te de nyid chos rdo rje khro gnyer ma ste phyag mtshan la sogs pa na bza' dkar mo dang 'dra ba la dmar skya'i mdog can /
translated: From the great pledge, i.e., from Amitābha, the Dharma-vajra, the frowning one, is not transgressed, and she is similar to the white-clad one in having the same hand implements, etc., but is pale red in color,

original: thod pa'i phreng ba dang ldan pa mche ba cung zad gtsigs pa phyung ngo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: thod pa'i phreng ba dang ldan pa mche ba cung zad gtsigs pa phyung ngo zhes pa'o //
translated: has a garland of skulls, and slightly bared fangs.

original: rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po ni 'dis dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po ni 'dis dgug par bya'o //
translated: The king of knowledge-holders should summon her with this.

original: gong ma ltar ye shes rgyal po ni snang ba mtha' yas te dran pas 'jigs pa dang bral lo zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: gong ma ltar ye shes rgyal po ni snang ba mtha' yas te dran pas 'jigs pa dang bral lo zhes sbyar ro //
translated: As above, the king of pristine awareness is Amitābha, and by being mindful one is free from fear.

original: de'i las gsungs pa rig pa 'dzin pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i las gsungs pa rig pa 'dzin pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: His action is taught beginning with “the knowledge holder,” and so forth.

original: sngags kyi rig pa ni khro gnyer ma'i sngags so //
analyzed: sngags kyi rig pa ni khro gnyer ma'i sngags so //
translated: The knowledge of mantra is the mantra of Hatred Vajrī.

original: dam tshig mchog gis dgug par bya //
analyzed: dam tshig mchog gis dgug par bya //
translated: One should summon with the supreme pledge.

original: zhes pa ni gong du gsungs pa'i sbyor ba'i dam tshig la sogs pas dgug par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gong du gsungs pa'i sbyor ba'i dam tshig la sogs pas dgug par bya'o zhes so //
translated: This means that one should summon with the pledge of union and so forth taught above.

original: de ni rim pa gnyis pa'i bsam gtan 'ba' zhig gis dgug pa gsungs pa //
analyzed: de ni rim pa gnyis pa'i bsam gtan 'ba' zhig gis dgug pa gsungs pa //
translated: This is the teaching on summoning by means of the meditation of the second stage alone.

original: 'gog pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The stopping of the mind and so forth.

original: 'gog pa zhes pa ni sems kyis kun du spyod pa gzhan dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa zhes pa ni sems kyis kun du spyod pa gzhan dang bral ba'o //
translated: “Stopping” means being free from other mental activities.

original: mi phyed pas rdo rje ste mdzes par byed pas na rgyal po'o //
analyzed: mi phyed pas rdo rje ste mdzes par byed pas na rgyal po'o //
translated: Since it is indivisible, it is a vajra, and since it beautifies, it is a king.

original: de nyid rim pa gnyis pas na yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rim pa gnyis pas na yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Since it is the reality of the second stage, it is complete.

original: des sems brgyan pas na mdzes pa mchog ste /
analyzed: des sems brgyan pas na mdzes pa mchog ste /
translated: Since the mind is adorned by that, it is the supreme beauty.

original: mi g-yo ba bsgrub bya der chud par byas pas ye @85a * //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba bsgrub bya der chud par byas pas ye @85a * //
translated: Having caused the one to be summoned to enter there,

original: shes rdo rje gsum las byung ba yang khugs na sngags kyi rgyud la sogs pa'i bsgrub bya lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: shes rdo rje gsum las byung ba yang khugs na sngags kyi rgyud la sogs pa'i bsgrub bya lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: the knowledge-being, arisen from the three vajras, is summoned, let alone the one to be summoned in the mantra-tantra, etc.

original: de thams cad kyang 'di'i sprul pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thams cad kyang 'di'i sprul pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all of those are also emanations of him.

original: de bas na des lus la sogs pa med pa yang de ma thag tu 'gugs zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na des lus la sogs pa med pa yang de ma thag tu 'gugs zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should apply “even though he has no body, etc., he is immediately summoned.”

original: da ni khro bo gang yang rung ba'i rnal 'byor pas sngags kyi rgyud dang ldan pa'i mngon spyod gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni khro bo gang yang rung ba'i rnal 'byor pas sngags kyi rgyud dang ldan pa'i mngon spyod gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the rite of assault endowed with the mantra-tantra is stated by the yogin of any wrathful one:

original: yang na zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Or else, the mantra-holder, having become wrathful,🔽should summon the one to be summoned with the mantra of any wrathful one.”

original: yang na zhes pa ni dgug pa la rnam grangs bsnyags pa'o //
analyzed: yang na zhes pa ni dgug pa la rnam grangs bsnyags pa'o //
translated: Or else is a synonym for summoning.

original: khro bo thams cad ces pa ni khro bo gang yang rung ba'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: khro bo thams cad ces pa ni khro bo gang yang rung ba'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas zhes pa'o //
translated: All wrathful ones is to be connected with the yogin of any wrathful one.

original: sngags pas 'bum du bzlas byas na //
analyzed: sngags pas 'bum du bzlas byas na //
translated: The mantra-holder, having recited one hundred thousand times,

original: zhes pa ni dpag tu med pa'i bzlas pa byas pas sngags pa rnam par dag ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dpag tu med pa'i bzlas pa byas pas sngags pa rnam par dag ste /
translated: This is the recitation of the mantra practitioner who has done an immeasurable number of recitations.

original: des dben pa'i gnas su 'bum phrag gcig bzlas pa byas na 'gugs pa dang gsod pa la sogs pa'i las thams cad byed par bshad ces so //
analyzed: des dben pa'i gnas su 'bum phrag gcig bzlas pa byas na 'gugs pa dang gsod pa la sogs pa'i las thams cad byed par bshad ces so //
translated: It is explained that if he recites one hundred thousand times in an isolated place, he can do all the rites of summoning, killing, and so forth.

original: de bas na grangs dang ldan pa'i bzlas brjod ni lus can sdig pa dang bral ba'i sngags pa la gsungs pa ste gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na grangs dang ldan pa'i bzlas brjod ni lus can sdig pa dang bral ba'i sngags pa la gsungs pa ste gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the recitation with a counted number is taught for the mantra practitioner who is free of sin, not for others.

original: ji skad du //
analyzed: ji skad du //
translated: As it is said:

original: rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub ba'i rgyud las /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub ba'i rgyud las /
translated: In the Vairocanābhisambodhi Tantra,

original: bzla brjod grangs tshad gsungs pa ni //
analyzed: bzla brjod grangs tshad gsungs pa ni //
translated: The number of recitations taught

original: phal cher ngas ni bstan pa yang //🔽lus can sdig pa bral ba yi //
analyzed: phal cher ngas ni bstan pa yang // lus can sdig pa bral ba yi //
translated: Is mostly taught by me🔽For the mantra practitioner who is free of sin,

original: sngags pa rnam par dag pa las //
analyzed: sngags pa rnam par dag pa las //
translated: Who is pure,

original: gzhan du bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du bya ba ma yin no //
translated: And not for others.

original: zhes so // las kyi bsgrub bya gsungs pa //
analyzed: zhes so // las kyi bsgrub bya gsungs pa //
translated: The object of the rite is taught

original: rdo rje slob dpon zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the line “the vajra master,” and so forth.

original: rab tu dben pa'i gnas dag tu //
analyzed: rab tu dben pa'i gnas dag tu //
translated: In a very isolated place,

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: The line “in a very isolated place”

original: der bzlas brjod gong du gsungs pa bya bar gsungs ba bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: der bzlas brjod gong du gsungs pa bya bar gsungs ba bya bar bstan to //
translated: It is taught that one should do the recitation above.

original: las la sbyor ba'i gnas ni 'og nas ston to //
analyzed: las la sbyor ba'i gnas ni 'og nas ston to //
translated: The place of application of the rite is taught below.

original: lus can sdig pa dang ldan pa bsang ba dang bskrad pa'i yon tan ni byang chub mchog dang zhi ba la sogs pa'i sngags kyi dngos grub kyang thob par 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: lus can sdig pa dang ldan pa bsang ba dang bskrad pa'i yon tan ni byang chub mchog dang zhi ba la sogs pa'i sngags kyi dngos grub kyang thob par 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: The quality of purifying and expelling embodied beings who have evil is that one will also attain the power of the mantra of supreme enlightenment, peace, and so forth.

original: bsgrub bya la nyes pa bsgo ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gsungs pa /
analyzed: bsgrub bya la nyes pa bsgo ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gsungs pa /
translated: It is said that one should visualize the special meditative stabilization of charging the victim with faults.

original: phyogs bcu'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: [The verse] beginning with “the sentient beings of the ten directions” is that.

original: phyogs bcu'i sems can gyi lus dang ngag dang sems gsang pa ni le'u bco lnga pa las bshad do //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sems can gyi lus dang ngag dang sems gsang pa ni le'u bco lnga pa las bshad do //
translated: The body, speech, and mind secrets of the sentient beings of the ten directions are explained in chapter fifteen.

original: de khyad par dag tu sngon du bsgoms pas dgra rnams gdon @85b mi za bar 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: de khyad par dag tu sngon du bsgoms pas dgra rnams gdon @85b mi za bar 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: By meditating on those in particular beforehand, the enemies will certainly die.

original: da ni las la sbyor ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni las la sbyor ba gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the application of the rite is taught.

original: khrag dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khrag dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: [The verse] beginning with “blood and” is that.

original: khrag dang chu yis gsher ba'i gos sam /
analyzed: khrag dang chu yis gsher ba'i gos sam /
translated: A cloth moistened with blood and water

original: yang na bshang gcis gsher ba'i gos bgos nas bsgrub bya'i ling+ga rkang pas mnan pa'o //🔽khro bo ni gdug pa'i las sgrub pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: yang na bshang gcis gsher ba'i gos bgos nas bsgrub bya'i ling+ga rkang pas mnan pa'o // khro bo ni gdug pa'i las sgrub pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Or else, having put on a wet garment with feces and urine, one should step on the victim's lingam.

original: las thams cad byed pas na /
analyzed: las thams cad byed pas na /
translated: One should apply the king of wrathful ones, because of accomplishing the fierce action, or because of performing all actions.

original: khro bo rgyal po sbyar bar bya //
analyzed: khro bo rgyal po sbyar bar bya //
translated: One should apply the king of wrathful ones.

original: zhes so // brgya rtsa brgyad ni grangs so //
analyzed: zhes so // brgya rtsa brgyad ni grangs so //
translated: One should recite one hundred and eight times.

original: des sangs rgyas dag kyang 'jig na gzhan lha smos kyang ci dgos so //
analyzed: des sangs rgyas dag kyang 'jig na gzhan lha smos kyang ci dgos so //
translated: By that, even the Buddhas are destroyed, so what need is there to mention other gods?

original: de bzhin du chu dron gyis gos gsher bar byas nas khro bo mchog gi zhes ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du chu dron gyis gos gsher bar byas nas khro bo mchog gi zhes ste /
translated: Similarly, having made a garment wet with hot water, one should apply the supreme wrathful one.

original: khro bo mchog gi rnal 'byor pas bgos nas lha chen po'i gzugs rkang pas mnan na /
analyzed: khro bo mchog gi rnal 'byor pas bgos nas lha chen po'i gzugs rkang pas mnan na /
translated: Having put on the supreme wrathful one, if one steps on the form of a great god with one's foot,

original: sangs rgyas dag kyang 'jig ces pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dag kyang 'jig ces pa'o //
translated: even the Buddhas are destroyed.

original: de bzhin du bshang gcis spangs pa'i gos ngan pa rdul pa'i dri ma mnam pa bgos nas gong ma ltar byas na bskams te 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bshang gcis spangs pa'i gos ngan pa rdul pa'i dri ma mnam pa bgos nas gong ma ltar byas na bskams te 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, having put on a bad garment abandoned by feces and urine, with the bad smell of dirt, if one does as above, one will be dried up and die.

original: thal ba'i skyoms gsher ba'i gos gon nas lus dang sems khros pas 'khrugs par byas nas brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas na rdo rje sems dpa' 'jig par 'gyur na gzhan lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes so //
analyzed: thal ba'i skyoms gsher ba'i gos gon nas lus dang sems khros pas 'khrugs par byas nas brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas na rdo rje sems dpa' 'jig par 'gyur na gzhan lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes so //
translated: Having put on a wet garment of ashes, and having made one's body and mind disturbed by anger, if one repeats [the mantra] one hundred and eight times, even Vajrasattva will be destroyed, so what need is there to mention anyone else?

original: gos dang mi ldan pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: gos dang mi ldan pa gsungs pa /
translated: [The Bhagavān] declares the lack of clothing:

original: gcer bu zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gcer bu zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Naked and so forth.

original: gcer bur phyung la skra'i rtse mo thur du ba shig la lus 'jigs pa'i tshul du mche ba gtsigs shing mig 'gyur ba byas nas rkang pas bsgrub bya'i ling+ga mnan nas sngags bzlas na //
analyzed: gcer bur phyung la skra'i rtse mo thur du ba shig la lus 'jigs pa'i tshul du mche ba gtsigs shing mig 'gyur ba byas nas rkang pas bsgrub bya'i ling+ga mnan nas sngags bzlas na //
translated: Having bared oneself, having let one's hair hang down, having made one's body terrifying with bared fangs and rolling eyes, having stepped on the victim's liṅga with one's foot, one should repeat the mantra.

original: 'dus ma byas nam mkha' yang 'jigs par nus na gzhan lta ci smos zhes sbyor ba'i mthu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas nam mkha' yang 'jigs par nus na gzhan lta ci smos zhes sbyor ba'i mthu bstan pa'o //
translated: If one is able to destroy even the uncompounded space, what need is there to mention anyone else? This shows the power of the application.

original: de la mngon spyod kyi gnas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la mngon spyod kyi gnas gsungs pa /
translated: [The Bhagavān] declares the place of the rite of assault:

original: ma mo'i gnas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma mo'i gnas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The place of the mātṛs and so forth.

original: de'i don ni 'di lta ste lha khro bo'i rnal 'byor pas ji skad bshad pa'i bya ba byas pa'i khyad par kha sbyar dbye ba sngon du byas nas ji skad du gsungs pa'i rdzas la gzugs brnyan byas la ma mo'i gnas la sogs pa gang gyang rung ba
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di lta ste lha khro bo'i rnal 'byor pas ji skad bshad pa'i bya ba byas pa'i khyad par kha sbyar dbye ba sngon du byas nas ji skad du gsungs pa'i rdzas la gzugs brnyan byas la ma mo'i gnas la sogs pa gang gyang rung ba
translated: in a place of the mātṛkās, and so on,

original: khrag la sogs pas gsher ba'i gos dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: khrag la sogs pas gsher ba'i gos dang ldan pa'am /
translated: wearing a garment wet with blood, and so on,

original: yang na gcer bur byung ste rkang pas mnan nas brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pa tsam gyis ji skad gsungs pa 'grub par 'gyur ro @86a * //
analyzed: yang na gcer bur byung ste rkang pas mnan nas brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pa tsam gyis ji skad gsungs pa 'grub par 'gyur ro @86a * //
translated: or else, having gone forth naked, having stepped on it with his foot, by merely reciting it one hundred and eight times, what was taught will be accomplished.

original: zhes so // da ni mtshan ma de la phur bus gdab pa'i cho ga gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // da ni mtshan ma de la phur bus gdab pa'i cho ga gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the rite of nailing it down with a kīla is taught:

original: mi rus zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi rus zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: With human bone, and so on.

original: de yang gong du gsungs pa'i rnal 'byor pas dur khrod kyi ras la ske tshe dang / dug dang lan tshva dang yungs mar gyis khro bo'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa rnon po bris la de'i lte bar sngags dang spel ba'i bsgrub par bya ba'i ming bris te /🔽ro bsregs pa'i thal ba dang sol ba dang / chu dogs gnyis kyi sa dang / phub ma dang / bsgrub bya'i rkang rjes kyi sa bsdus la bshad pa dang gci bas sbrus te gzugs brnyan byas la de'i snying gar bcug la gong ma ltar kha sbyar dbye ba yang byas nas mi'i rus pa las byas pa'i phur bu sor brgyad pa la sngags brgya rtsa brgyad du
analyzed: de yang gong du gsungs pa'i rnal 'byor pas dur khrod kyi ras la ske tshe dang / dug dang lan tshva dang yungs mar gyis khro bo'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa rnon po bris la de'i lte bar sngags dang spel ba'i bsgrub par bya ba'i ming bris te / ro bsregs pa'i thal ba dang sol ba dang / chu dogs gnyis kyi sa dang / phub ma dang / bsgrub bya'i rkang rjes kyi sa bsdus la bshad pa dang gci bas sbrus te gzugs brnyan byas la de'i snying gar bcug la gong ma ltar kha sbyar dbye ba yang byas nas mi'i rus pa las byas pa'i phur bu sor brgyad pa la sngags brgya rtsa brgyad du
translated: Moreover, the yogī/nī mentioned above should draw a sharp five-pronged vajra of the wrathful one on a charnel ground cloth with black mustard seed, poison, salt, and black mustard oil. In its center, he should write the name of the victim, along with the mantra.🔽He should collect the ashes and soot of a burned corpse, earth from two river deltas, chaff, and earth from the victim’s footprints. He should knead these with the victim’s feces and make an effigy. He should insert the above [drawing] into its heart, and, as before, separate the joined [vajras].

original: bzlas nas de'i snying ngar btab ste /
analyzed: bzlas nas de'i snying ngar btab ste /
translated: He should enchant an eight-finger-width kīla made of human bone one hundred and eight times with the mantra and plant it in the heart of the effigy.

original: dgra'i sgo 'am gang yang rung bar sbas na ji skad du gsungs pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgra'i sgo 'am gang yang rung bar sbas na ji skad du gsungs pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he buries it at the door of the enemy’s house or wherever, he will accomplish [the rite] as stated.

original: sangs rgyas nyid sku gsum mchog sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid sku gsum mchog sbyin pa'o //
translated: Buddhahood is the supreme gift of the three bodies.

original: de nyid shes pa thams cad kyi phul du phyin pa mi shes pa thams cad rnam par spangs pa yang bskams nas 'chi bar 'gyur na gzhan lta ci smos zhes bsad pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: de nyid shes pa thams cad kyi phul du phyin pa mi shes pa thams cad rnam par spangs pa yang bskams nas 'chi bar 'gyur na gzhan lta ci smos zhes bsad pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: The rite of killing is: Having dried up all ignorance, having abandoned all ignorance, he will die, having become the best of all knowers of reality, much more so than others.

original: gnas nas spo ba'i cho ga gsungs pa /
analyzed: gnas nas spo ba'i cho ga gsungs pa /
translated: The rite of banishing is stated:

original: yang na zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Or else, etc.

original: yang zhes pa ni mi gsod na'o ;
analyzed: yang zhes pa ni mi gsod na'o ;
translated: Or else means if one does not kill.

original: / thod pa gang ba dag ces pa ni thod pa rin po che'o //
analyzed: / thod pa gang ba dag ces pa ni thod pa rin po che'o //
translated: A skull filled with jewels is a skull filled with jewels.

original: khyad par du ni zhes pa ni pho dang mo bskrad pa la de dang rjes su mthun pa btsal lo //
analyzed: khyad par du ni zhes pa ni pho dang mo bskrad pa la de dang rjes su mthun pa btsal lo //
translated: In particular means that one should seek out a male or female to be banished in accordance with that.

original: de yang lha khro bo'i sbyor bas ji skad du bshad pa'i thod pa la /
analyzed: de yang lha khro bo'i sbyor bas ji skad du bshad pa'i thod pa la /
translated: Moreover, with the wrathful deity's yoga, as was explained, in the skull,

original: aa ri sha'i lo ma'i khu ba dang / rkang pa g-yon pa'i srin lag gi khrag gis rlung gi dkyil 'khor la ral gris mtshan pa bris la de'i steng du bsgrub bya'i gzugs de'i snying gar sngags kyi tshig dang ming spel ba bris nas bkug ste /
analyzed: aa ri sha'i lo ma'i khu ba dang / rkang pa g-yon pa'i srin lag gi khrag gis rlung gi dkyil 'khor la ral gris mtshan pa bris la de'i steng du bsgrub bya'i gzugs de'i snying gar sngags kyi tshig dang ming spel ba bris nas bkug ste /
translated: With juice of the asura leaf and blood of the left ring finger, draw a sword on the wind maṇḍala, and on top of that, write the mantra syllables and the name of the victim, whose form is written in the heart. Summon him,

original: brgya rtsa brgyad mngon par bzlas shing rdo rje'i thor tshugs te ral pa gcig ma 'am gang yang rung ba'i rnal 'byor pas dgra'i sgo 'am grong du sbas te bzhag na nges par skrod par 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: brgya rtsa brgyad mngon par bzlas shing rdo rje'i thor tshugs te ral pa gcig ma 'am gang yang rung ba'i rnal 'byor pas dgra'i sgo 'am grong du sbas te bzhag na nges par skrod par 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: and repeat [the mantra] one hundred and eight times. The yogin of Vajroṣṇīṣa, or any other, should bury it at the door of the enemy's house or town. He will certainly be expelled.

original: cho ga gzhan gsungs pa /
analyzed: cho ga gzhan gsungs pa /
translated: Another rite is taught:

original: ta la'i lo ma zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ta la'i lo ma zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: With a palm leaf, etc.

original: de rnams la gong ma'i cho ga nyid kyis gzugs brnyan byas nas khyim ma ma sgo dag tu sbas na nges par skrod de ma bskrad na @86b yang 'chi ba 'am bskams par 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: de rnams la gong ma'i cho ga nyid kyis gzugs brnyan byas nas khyim ma ma sgo dag tu sbas na nges par skrod de ma bskrad na @86b yang 'chi ba 'am bskams par 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: Having made an effigy of them with the above rite, if it is buried at the door of the house, they will certainly be expelled. If they are not expelled, they will die or dry up.

original: dam tshig chen po ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig chen po ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The great pledge is Vajrasattva.

original: khro bo rnams kyi dpal lta bur gnas pas khro bo'i tog go //
analyzed: khro bo rnams kyi dpal lta bur gnas pas khro bo'i tog go //
translated: Since he abides like the glory of the wrathful ones, he is the crest-jewel of the wrathful ones.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi phur bus mngon spyod bya ba'i cho ga gsungs pa /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi phur bus mngon spyod bya ba'i cho ga gsungs pa /
translated: The ritual of the rite of violence with the dagger of body, speech, and mind is taught.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, etc.

original: sku gsung thugs gang gi nges par 'chi ba nyid rdo rje ste /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs gang gi nges par 'chi ba nyid rdo rje ste /
translated: The dagger of body, speech, and mind is the vajra of death itself.

original: rdo rje gsum mo //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum mo //
translated: It is the three vajras.

original: khams gsum pa thams cad ni bsgrub bya'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: khams gsum pa thams cad ni bsgrub bya'i khyad par ro //
translated: All the three realms is the distinction of the victim.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs ni lus ngag yid gsum mo //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs ni lus ngag yid gsum mo //
translated: Body, speech, and mind are body, speech, and mind.

original: de phur bus mnan pa'i sngags 'di phyung ngo zhes so //
analyzed: de phur bus mnan pa'i sngags 'di phyung ngo zhes so //
translated: He emitted this mantra of the dagger of those three.

original: sngags 'di la sarbba dusht'an zhes pa dang sarbba s'a pam zhes pa gnyis bsal nas che ge mo k'a ya b'ak tsitta zhes spel bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngags 'di la sarbba dusht'an zhes pa dang sarbba s'a pam zhes pa gnyis bsal nas che ge mo k'a ya b'ak tsitta zhes spel bar bya'o //
translated: In this mantra, having eliminated the two, all enemies and all misfortunes, one should insert so-and-so’s body, speech, and mind.

original: rdo rje rdzu 'phrul chen po ni rdo rje gsum mo //
analyzed: rdo rje rdzu 'phrul chen po ni rdo rje gsum mo //
translated: The great magic vajra is the three vajras.

original: rol mo bstan pa'i phyir brgyal zhing 'jigs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rol mo bstan pa'i phyir brgyal zhing 'jigs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate the music, he fainted and was frightened.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' dran na 'jigs pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' dran na 'jigs pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that there is no fear if one recollects Vajrasattva,

original: nam mkha'i rdo rje sems dran 'gyur //
analyzed: nam mkha'i rdo rje sems dran 'gyur //
translated: it is said, “One should recollect the vajra of space.”

original: zhes so // las gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // las gsungs pa /
translated: The action is stated:

original: mi'i rus pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi'i rus pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “One should drive in a stake of human bone,” and so forth.

original: gong du gsungs pa'i bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan la rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas /🔽mi'i rus pa'i phur bu sor brgyad pa'i rtse mor rnam par snang mdzad kyi 'khor lo'i rtse mor bsams nas me tog sngon pos mchod cing 'dzab byas la spyi bor btab na glang tsher can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gong du gsungs pa'i bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan la rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas / mi'i rus pa'i phur bu sor brgyad pa'i rtse mor rnam par snang mdzad kyi 'khor lo'i rtse mor bsams nas me tog sngon pos mchod cing 'dzab byas la spyi bor btab na glang tsher can du 'gyur ro //
translated: With regard to the image of the victim as previously described, the yogin of Vairochana🔽should imagine a stake of human bone eight finger-widths long at the tip of the wheel of Vairochana, worship it with blue flowers, perform the meditative repetition, and drive it into the crown of the victim’s head. He will become a porcupine.

original: snang ba mtha' yas kyi rnal 'byor pas seng ldeng gi rtse mo las bskyed pa'i phur bu sor brgyad padma'i rtse mor byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: snang ba mtha' yas kyi rnal 'byor pas seng ldeng gi rtse mo las bskyed pa'i phur bu sor brgyad padma'i rtse mor byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: The yogin of Amitābha should bless a stake generated from the tip of a teak tree, eight finger-widths long, at the tip of a lotus,

original: me tog sngon pos mchod cing 'dzab byas nas btab la thod pa kha sbyar du bcug nas dur khrod kyi me la bdugs na tsha ba'i nad kyis 'debs so //
analyzed: me tog sngon pos mchod cing 'dzab byas nas btab la thod pa kha sbyar du bcug nas dur khrod kyi me la bdugs na tsha ba'i nad kyis 'debs so //
translated: Having worshipped with blue flowers and performed the recitation, one should drive in the dagger, and having sealed the skull, if one fumigates it with charnel ground fire, one will be afflicted with a hot disease.

original: mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas lcags las byas pa'i phur bu rdo rje rtse mo can la me tog sngon pos mchod cing 'dzab byas la btab nas me sbar bar bsgyur na mtshan mo de nyid la 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas lcags las byas pa'i phur bu rdo rje rtse mo can la me tog sngon pos mchod cing 'dzab byas la btab nas me sbar bar bsgyur na mtshan mo de nyid la 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: A yogin of Akṣobhya, having worshipped with blue flowers and performed the recitation, should drive in a dagger made of iron with a vajra point, and if one transforms it into a fire, one will die that very night.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: rdo rje sku gsum 'jig par 'gyur //
analyzed: rdo rje sku gsum 'jig par 'gyur //
translated: the vajra body will be destroyed.

original: zhes sbyor ba'i mthu'o //
analyzed: zhes sbyor ba'i mthu'o //
translated: This is the power of the union.

original: da ni le'u bcu pa'i snying po bskul ba'i de ma thag tu 'og nas 'byung ba'i cho gas rigs dang 'brel ba'i phur bus gdab ba gsungs pa /🔽'od 'phro zhes pa @87a * //
analyzed: da ni le'u bcu pa'i snying po bskul ba'i de ma thag tu 'og nas 'byung ba'i cho gas rigs dang 'brel ba'i phur bus gdab ba gsungs pa / 'od 'phro zhes pa @87a * //
translated: Now, immediately after the essence of chapter ten is aroused, the driving in with the dagger connected with the family by the rite that will occur below is stated:

original: la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa'o //
translated: The radiance, etc.

original: de la 'od zer 'phro zhing 'khrugs pa mdangs bzang po'i rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: de la 'od zer 'phro zhing 'khrugs pa mdangs bzang po'i rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
translated: There, the radiance, the disturbance, is the excellent splendor Vajrasattva.
