translated: Now, in order to introduce the deity to the disciple who has entered the maṇḍala and to ascertain the power of the yogin by the yoga of the immediately antecedent state, [the Bhagavān] declares, “Then,” and so on.

original: lung gi gzhir gyur pa'i phyir gtso bo'o //
analyzed: lung gi gzhir gyur pa'i phyir gtso bo'o //
translated: The principal one is because it is the basis of the scripture.

original: phung po la sogs pa thams cad dag pa'i bdag por gyur pas na chos rnams kun gyis phyug pa'o //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa thams cad dag pa'i bdag por gyur pas na chos rnams kun gyis phyug pa'o //
translated: It is rich with all dharmas because it is the lord of the purification of all aggregates and so on.

original: sku gsum gyi rang bzhin pas na sku dang gsung thugs yongs su dag pa ste tha ma nas so //
analyzed: sku gsum gyi rang bzhin pas na sku dang gsung thugs yongs su dag pa ste tha ma nas so //
translated: It is the purity of body, speech, and mind because it is the nature of the three bodies.

original: cung zad ye shes dbang du gyur bas dbab pa'i gnas gsungs pa /
analyzed: cung zad ye shes dbang du gyur bas dbab pa'i gnas gsungs pa /
translated: The place of descent is taught, since one has a little mastery of gnosis.

original: ri rtse zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ri rtse zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The peak of a mountain and so forth.

original: bsam gtan rdo rje ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i rim pas rab tu bya zhes so //
analyzed: bsam gtan rdo rje ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i rim pas rab tu bya zhes so //
translated: The vajra concentration is to be done by the procedure that will be taught below.

original: gsang sngags bzlas pa'i sbyor ba yang 'og nas 'byung ba'i h'um la sogs pa bzlas pa dang de'i rnal 'byor gyis dbab ces pa'o //
analyzed: gsang sngags bzlas pa'i sbyor ba yang 'og nas 'byung ba'i h'um la sogs pa bzlas pa dang de'i rnal 'byor gyis dbab ces pa'o //
translated: The application of mantra repetition is the descent by the yoga of the repetition of HŪṀ and so forth that will be taught below.

original: de ltar phab na de'i lhas thams cad byed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar phab na de'i lhas thams cad byed pa gsungs pa /
translated: If one descends in that way, it is taught that all the deities do that.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pa'o //🔽rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pa'o // rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The vajra beings and so forth.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' sogs kyi sgras bsdus pa rtag pa dang / 'od dpag med dang / skul byed ma la sogs pa'o //🔽sngags dang bsam gtan gyis bskul @95a * //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' sogs kyi sgras bsdus pa rtag pa dang / 'od dpag med dang / skul byed ma la sogs pa'o // sngags dang bsam gtan gyis bskul @95a * //
translated: The term vajra beings and so forth includes the eternal, Amitābha, Cāriṇī, and so forth.

original: ba yang 'og nas ston to //
analyzed: ba yang 'og nas ston to //
translated: The enjoined by mantra and concentration will be taught below.

original: las rnams thams cad byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: las rnams thams cad byed par 'gyur //
translated: They will do all the rites.

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor bri ba dang me tog dor ba la sogs pa'i dgongs pa sgrub par byed do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor bri ba dang me tog dor ba la sogs pa'i dgongs pa sgrub par byed do zhes pa'o //
translated: This is the accomplishment of the intention of drawing the mandala, casting the flower, and so forth.

original: da ni dbab pa'i thabs kyi cho ga gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni dbab pa'i thabs kyi cho ga gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the ritual of the method of descent is stated:

original: rdo rje chos zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje chos zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The vajra dharma, and so forth.

original: de yang ji skad du gsungs pa'i snod aa las rdo rje chos 'od dpag med kyi gzugs padma r'a ga'i mdog 'dra ba lhag par mos pas bsams te /
analyzed: de yang ji skad du gsungs pa'i snod aa las rdo rje chos 'od dpag med kyi gzugs padma r'a ga'i mdog 'dra ba lhag par mos pas bsams te /
translated: Moreover, one should imagine the vessel as stated, the vajra dharma arisen from A, the form of Amitabha, the color of a lotus flower, by way of resolute imagination.

original: de la sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje che /
analyzed: de la sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje che /
translated: In that, the great vajra of body, speech, and mind,

original: gnas gsum du rigs kyi brtag pa bya'o zhes so //🔽de yang snying gar lam las byung pa'i dbang chen ser po grva bzhir rdo rjes mtshan pa'i dbus su h'um sngon po bsam mo //
analyzed: gnas gsum du rigs kyi brtag pa bya'o zhes so // de yang snying gar lam las byung pa'i dbang chen ser po grva bzhir rdo rjes mtshan pa'i dbus su h'um sngon po bsam mo //
translated: one should investigate the three places with the three families.🔽Moreover, at the heart, one should imagine a blue HŪṀ in the center of a yellow great lord arisen from LAM, marked with a vajra in the four corners.

original: mgrin par bam las gyur pa'i chu'i dkyil 'khor zlum po bum pas mtshan pa'i a'a: dmar po bsam /
analyzed: mgrin par bam las gyur pa'i chu'i dkyil 'khor zlum po bum pas mtshan pa'i a'a: dmar po bsam /
translated: At the throat, one should imagine a red AḤ in the center of a round water mandala arisen from VAṂ, marked with a vase.

original: spyi bor yam las byung ba'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor gzhu lta bu ba dan gyis mtshan pa'i dbus su h'a: dkar po bsams pas byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: spyi bor yam las byung ba'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor gzhu lta bu ba dan gyis mtshan pa'i dbus su h'a: dkar po bsams pas byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: The consecration is to imagine a white HÃḤ in the center of a bow-shaped wind mandala arisen from YAM at the crown, marked with pennants.

original: de nas de'i rkang pa'i 'og tu rlung gi steng du me'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i dzheem 'bar ba bsams nas /
analyzed: de nas de'i rkang pa'i 'og tu rlung gi steng du me'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i dzheem 'bar ba bsams nas /
translated: Then, below his feet, one should imagine a blazing JHEḤ on a fire mandala on the wind.

original: rlung la sogs pa'i rim pas dzheem bskul ba'i 'od zer gyi chogs 'khrug cing rkang pa'i mthil nas rkang pa'i bar du 'bar bar gyur par bsam mo //
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa'i rim pas dzheem bskul ba'i 'od zer gyi chogs 'khrug cing rkang pa'i mthil nas rkang pa'i bar du 'bar bar gyur par bsam mo //
translated: By the sequence of wind and so forth, one should imagine that the mass of light rays that are the inciters of JHEḤ blaze from the soles of the feet to the crown.

original: de nas rigs gsum gyi bdag nyid can dang bskul bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rigs gsum gyi bdag nyid can dang bskul bar bya ste /
translated: Then, one should incite the one who is the nature of the three families.

original: rdo rje dril bu dang ldan par 'jigs su rung ba'i gar gyis a'a be sha ya stam bha ya ra ra ra ra rtsa la rtsa la h'um h'a:dzeeham zhes brjod pas dbab pa'i chog thams cad ni byas na gdon mi za bar 'grub ces pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dril bu dang ldan par 'jigs su rung ba'i gar gyis a'a be sha ya stam bha ya ra ra ra ra rtsa la rtsa la h'um h'a:dzeeham zhes brjod pas dbab pa'i chog thams cad ni byas na gdon mi za bar 'grub ces pa'o //
translated: By reciting AVELŚAYA STAMBHAYA RARA RARA RASA RASA HŪM HÃḤ JHEḤ, with a terrifying dance while holding the vajra and bell, all the rites of descent are accomplished without doubt.

original: rtags mthong ba de'i lce la thig le la a'a: dmar po bsams nas bhu hi badzra zhes brjod bas dge mi dge thams cad des ston par 'gyur ro zhe so //
analyzed: rtags mthong ba de'i lce la thig le la a'a: dmar po bsams nas bhu hi badzra zhes brjod bas dge mi dge thams cad des ston par 'gyur ro zhe so //
translated: Having visualized a red A: on the tip of the tongue of the one whose signs are seen, by saying Bhuh Vajra, all good and bad will be shown by that.

original: de nas kye rdo rje sdod cig ces brjod pas brtan por bya la me tog la sogs pa dor du gzhug go //
analyzed: de nas kye rdo rje sdod cig ces brjod pas brtan por bya la me tog la sogs pa dor du gzhug go //
translated: Then, by saying “O Vajra, stay!” one should stabilize [the disciple] and cause him to cast the flower, etc.

original: sa bla ba'i zhes pa ni dzre ste sa las steng du 'phar pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sa bla ba'i zhes pa ni dzre ste sa las steng du 'phar pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: “From the ground” is jra, which is the cause of leaping above the ground.

original: rigs chen ni sku'i rigs la sogs pa gsum mo //
analyzed: rigs chen ni sku'i rigs la sogs pa gsum mo //
translated: “Great family” is the three, the body family, etc.

original: de rnams ni 'phags pa bzhi po de bskul ba'o //🔽rdo rje grub pa dag gis bya //
analyzed: de rnams ni 'phags pa bzhi po de bskul ba'o // rdo rje grub pa dag gis bya //
translated: Those are the four noble ones who are urged.

original: zhes pa ni brten pa rdzogs pa'i sems kyis so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni brten pa rdzogs pa'i sems kyis so //
translated: “By the vajra accomplishments” is by the mind of perfect reliance.

original: brtag pa ni bde @95b pa chen po ste de 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: brtag pa ni bde @95b pa chen po ste de 'grub pa'o //
translated: “Examination” is great bliss, which is accomplished.

original: da ni cung zad ye shes dbang du gyur pa'i rnal 'byor pas snod rnam pa gnyis la ye shes kyi lha phab nas dkyil 'khor rnam pa gnyis bri ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni cung zad ye shes dbang du gyur pa'i rnal 'byor pas snod rnam pa gnyis la ye shes kyi lha phab nas dkyil 'khor rnam pa gnyis bri ba gsungs pa /
translated: Now, a yogi who has become a little bit of a lord of gnosis is taught to draw the two mandalas after the gnosis deity has been brought down into the two kinds of vessels.

original: bu mo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bu mo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The girl and so on.

original: lo bcu gnyis pa ni nyon mongs pa rags pa'i skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: lo bcu gnyis pa ni nyon mongs pa rags pa'i skyon med pa'o //
translated: The twelve-year-old is free from the fault of coarse afflictions.

original: mtshan nyid yongs su rdzogs pa ni rigs btsun pa la sogs pa padma'i zhal lnga nas kyis mdzes pa'i cho ga las byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid yongs su rdzogs pa ni rigs btsun pa la sogs pa padma'i zhal lnga nas kyis mdzes pa'i cho ga las byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: The one with perfect characteristics is like one arisen from the rite of beautifying the five lotus faces with a noble family and so on.

original: cho ga thams cad byas nas ni //
analyzed: cho ga thams cad byas nas ni //
translated: Having performed all the rites,

original: zhes pa ni gong ma ltar dbab pa'i cho ga thams cad byas nas des thig dang tsho na dgye pa la sogs pa'i las rnams rab tu bskul bar bya zhes so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gong ma ltar dbab pa'i cho ga thams cad byas nas des thig dang tsho na dgye pa la sogs pa'i las rnams rab tu bskul bar bya zhes so //
translated: having performed all the rites of descent as above, one should incite the actions of the straight line, the square, and so on.

original: las kyi mthu yod pas rnam pa gzhan te slob dpon slob ma la sogs pas las byas na lus ngag yid gsum dang ldan pa'i khams gsum gyi skye po ste /
analyzed: las kyi mthu yod pas rnam pa gzhan te slob dpon slob ma la sogs pas las byas na lus ngag yid gsum dang ldan pa'i khams gsum gyi skye po ste /
translated: The one with the power of action is different, for if the disciple and so on perform the rite, the beings of the three realms endowed with body, speech, and mind

original: des nus par med do zhes dpyad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des nus par med do zhes dpyad par 'gyur ro //
translated: will not be able to do anything, it is analyzed.

original: de'i don ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows.

original: bya ba thams cad rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas khye'u bu mo 'khor lo'i khang par bcug ste ji skad du bshad pa'i tshogs dbab pa byas la /
analyzed: bya ba thams cad rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas khye'u bu mo 'khor lo'i khang par bcug ste ji skad du bshad pa'i tshogs dbab pa byas la /
translated: The yogi/nī who has completed all actions should place the boy and girl in the house of the wheel and perform the descent of the assembly as explained.

original: des thig gdab pa dang rngul tshon dgye ba byas nas bka' nod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des thig gdab pa dang rngul tshon dgye ba byas nas bka' nod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having done the sprinkling and the distribution of the colored powders, they will receive the command.

original: de'i lha gshegs su gsol nas de gnas su btang ste /
analyzed: de'i lha gshegs su gsol nas de gnas su btang ste /
translated: Having requested the deity to depart, they should be sent to their own places.

original: lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga la sogs pa bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga la sogs pa bya'o zhes so //
translated: The rite of consecration, etc., should be performed.

original: gong du bshad pa'i dbab pa'i snying po gsungs pa /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa'i dbab pa'i snying po gsungs pa /
translated: The essence of the descent explained above is stated:

original: de la snying po'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la snying po'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: There, the essence and so forth.

original: de'i nus pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i nus pa gsungs pa /
translated: Its power is stated:

original: nam mkha'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Space and so forth.

original: nam mkha' ni gzugs can ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni gzugs can ma yin pa ste /
translated: Space is not material;

original: de yang 'bab na sems dang bcas pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de yang 'bab na sems dang bcas pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes pa'o //
translated: if it descends, what need is there to mention the mind?

original: rtog pa thams cad spangs pa yi //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad spangs pa yi //
translated: Abandoning all concepts,

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i bdag nyid kyang //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i bdag nyid kyang //
translated: the nature of Vajrasattva,

original: cho ga bzhin du byas na 'bab //
analyzed: cho ga bzhin du byas na 'bab //
translated: if done according to the rite, it descends.

original: ces pa'o // snying po de rnams nyid lha'i ngo bo nyid yin par gsungs pa /
analyzed: ces pa'o // snying po de rnams nyid lha'i ngo bo nyid yin par gsungs pa /
translated: The essence of those essences is said to be the nature of the deity.

original: h'um ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: h'um ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: HUM is the vajra body, etc.

original: 'di ni gsang tshig bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gsang tshig bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching of the secret word.

original: zhes pa ni rdo rje gsum ni gsang ba ste de'i dam tshig ces pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdo rje gsum ni gsang ba ste de'i dam tshig ces pa'o //
translated: The three vajras are the secret, and that is the commitment.

original: skul bar byed par bshad ces pa ni skul byed ma'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: skul bar byed par bshad ces pa ni skul byed ma'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: It is explained as the one who impels, and is the essence of the one who impels.

original: ji ltar yin na /
analyzed: ji ltar yin na /
translated: How is that?

analyzed: thugs rdo rje babs pa'i rtags 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dge mi dge thams cad shes par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: ji skad du /

original: sku babs bas ni nam mkhar gnas //
analyzed: sku babs bas ni nam mkhar gnas //

original: zhes 'jig rten sgron ma las bshad do //

analyzed: da ni bdud rtsi 'khyil ba'i sbyor bas sdang ba tshar gcad pa'i cho ga gsungs pa /

analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: sku gsum gyi gnas yongs su dag pas na rdo rje gsum du snang ba'o //

translated: This means that even those who are not stable due to many activities, and who have not attained the signs, should practice the firm observances in order to not violate the commitments of protection.

analyzed: // gdug pa thams cad ni dkon mchog gsum la gnod pa byed pa la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: lha thams cad las la de kho na sbyor bas myur ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: ji ltar bya zhe na /

translated: with disheveled hair, naked, and with one’s genitals pressed, if one repeats the mantra, the three worlds

translated: will be destroyed, let alone others.

original: sbyor ba gzhan gsungs pa /

analyzed: bsregs pas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “By burning,” etc.

analyzed: ro bsregs pa'i thal ba 'ba' zhig la gzugs brnyan byas nas dur khrod du gong ma ltar stong rtsa brgyad bzlas na bsgrub bya 'chi'o zhes so //
translated: One should make an effigy from only the ash of a cremation fire, and as above, repeat [the mantra] one thousand and eight times in a charnel ground, and the victim will die.

analyzed: de yang ro bsregs pa'i thal ba la sogs pas me'i dkyil 'khor gru gsum byas la /

analyzed: du ba la sogs pas kha dog nag por byas la kha bye ba'i rtse gsum pas mtshan pa po son 'cha' la sogs pa'i me sbar la /
translated: Having blackened the color with smoke, etc., and marked it with a three-pronged vajra, one should light a fire with sticks that have knots, etc.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i cho gas me lha bskyed nas de'i zhal du gong du gsungs pa'i rdzas las byas pa'i gzugs brnyan gtub cing lan gsum du sbyin sreg byas nas de'i 'bras bu bdud rtsi 'khyil ba'i zhal gdangs pa mche ba rnon po h'um gi lce dang
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i cho gas me lha bskyed nas de'i zhal du gong du gsungs pa'i rdzas las byas pa'i gzugs brnyan gtub cing lan gsum du sbyin sreg byas nas de'i 'bras bu bdud rtsi 'khyil ba'i zhal gdangs pa mche ba rnon po h'um gi lce dang
translated: Having generated the fire god by the rite explained above, one should cut up the effigy made of the substances mentioned above and offer it into the fire god's mouth. Having performed the burnt offering three times, one should imagine the result, the open mouth of Amṛtakuṇḍali, with sharp fangs and a tongue of HŪṂ.

original: ldan par bsams nas ba lang sha la sogs pa sna tshogs de'i yan lag tu bsams nas sbyin sreg byas na rdo rje sems dpa' yang gdon mi za bar 'jig ces so //

translated: Having imagined that the various [offerings], such as beef, are its limbs, if one performs the burnt offering, even Vajrasattva will certainly be destroyed.

original: de bzhin du sha chen las gzugs brnyan byas la gong ma ltar sbyin sreg byas na rdo rje las byung ba yang 'jig ces ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sha chen las gzugs brnyan byas la gong ma ltar sbyin sreg byas na rdo rje las byung ba yang 'jig ces ba'o //
translated: Similarly, having made an effigy from human flesh and performed the burnt offering as above, even one arisen from a vajra will be destroyed.

original: de bzhin du gong ma ltar dgra'i gzugs brnyan byas nas bshad ci dag gis lus byugs nas che ge mo m'a ra ya phat ces pa'i tshigs dang ldan par gong gi thab khung du tsher ma'i me la thugs la sogs pa khros nas bsregs na sangs rgyas dag

translated: Likewise, having made an effigy of the enemy as before, having anointed it with the above substances, and having placed it in the above hearth, with a fire of thorns, etc., one should burn it with a wrathful mind, reciting the verse, “So and so, die, die!”

original: kyang nges par 'jig ces so //
analyzed: kyang nges par 'jig ces so //

analyzed: sbyor ba gzhan gsungs pa chu bo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //

original: de yang chu bo 'bab pa'i 'gram gnyis kyi sa la sogs pa las dgra bo'i gzugs brnyan byas la mgo byang du bstan la gan rkyal du bzhag la til gyi 'bras bu tsam du bar mtshams med par dug las byung ba'i tsher ma ste srang ko tsa dang
analyzed: de yang chu bo 'bab pa'i 'gram gnyis kyi sa la sogs pa las dgra bo'i gzugs brnyan byas la mgo byang du bstan la gan rkyal du bzhag la til gyi 'bras bu tsam du bar mtshams med par dug las byung ba'i tsher ma ste srang ko tsa dang
translated: Having made an effigy of the enemy from the earth of both banks of a river, etc., one should place it supine with its head to the north, and having planted in it, without interval, thorns that have arisen from poison, the size of sesame seeds,

translated: Mustard seed, salt, oil, poison, and dhattura are made into ink, and the name is written on charnel ground cloth, and it is placed in the heart of that effigy.

analyzed: gzhug pa'o // des sangs rgyas thams cad kyang gsong na gzhan lta ci smos zhes pa'o //

original: sbyor ba gzhan gsungs pa /
analyzed: sbyor ba gzhan gsungs pa /

original: sol khus zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sol khus zhes pa la sogs pa'o //

translated: With just that application, wearing clothes soaked with lye, with a wrathful mind, one makes an effigy of the enemy with bone ash, poison, and blood, and stepping on that effigy with the foot of Amṛtakuṇḍali, one recites the words of the invocation, “Kill so-and-so!”

original: ldan par brjod na rdo rje sems dpa' yang srin pos khyer bar byed na gzhan lta ci smos zhes so //
analyzed: ldan par brjod na rdo rje sems dpa' yang srin pos khyer bar byed na gzhan lta ci smos zhes so //
translated: If one does that, even Vajrasattva will be carried off by rākṣasas, let alone others.

original: sbyor ba gzhan gsungs pa /
analyzed: sbyor ba gzhan gsungs pa /
translated: Another application is stated:

original: skye tshe zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skye tshe zhes pa la sogs pa'o //

translated: By that application, one should mix the birth-time butter with feces and urine, and put it in the above-mentioned effigy, and by the foot of the fire wheel, one should press it down, and by the power of not releasing the urging, one will be tormented by intense heat.

analyzed: da ni las kyi tshogs gsungs pa'i 'khyil ba'i sngags gsungs pa /

analyzed: de la zhes pa la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: khro bo thams cad ni gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'o //

original: de las la sbyor ba'i snying po'o //
analyzed: de las la sbyor ba'i snying po'o //

analyzed: sbyin sreg gam yang na bsam gtan pa zhes pa ni sbyin sreg gi gong du gsungs pa'o //

analyzed: de bas na las 'di ni cho ga gsum gyis 'grub ste /

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: mtshan ma mnan nas bzlas pa'am //
analyzed: mtshan ma mnan nas bzlas pa'am //

analyzed: sbyin sreg khro bo rnal 'byor ram //
translated: or the yoga of wrathful burnt offerings,

original: gdug pa'i sems can bsam gtan gyis //
analyzed: gdug pa'i sems can bsam gtan gyis //

translated: Since that destroys the body, speech, and mind of the wrathful one, if one who is diligent does it with an undistracted mind, it is the supreme killing.

analyzed: las de thams cad pa'i khro bo bskyed pa'i rkyen gsungs pa rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The condition for generating all those rites of wrath is stated: Vajrasattva, etc.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa ni de sngon du gyur pa las cho ga bzhis sdang ba 'jig par mdzad pa'i khro bo ste bdud rtsi 'khyil ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa ni de sngon du gyur pa las cho ga bzhis sdang ba 'jig par mdzad pa'i khro bo ste bdud rtsi 'khyil ba'o //
translated: Vajrasattva is the wrathful one who, having been generated previously, destroys the hostile by the four rites, which is Amṛtakuṇḍali.

original: @97b de yang zhabs rnam par bgrad pa /
analyzed: @97b de yang zhabs rnam par bgrad pa /
translated: He also has legs wide apart,

original: zhal la sogs pa 'jigs 'jigs lta ba bsams nas las bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhal la sogs pa 'jigs 'jigs lta ba bsams nas las bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Having contemplated the face and so forth, one should perform the rite.

original: sta re tho ba phyag na bsnams //
analyzed: sta re tho ba phyag na bsnams //
translated: He holds an axe and a hammer in his hands.

original: zhes pas 'di ston te /
analyzed: zhes pas 'di ston te /
translated: This is taught by the verse.

original: bsgrub bya la nyes pa bsgo ba'i phyir bsam gtan gyis khyad par byas te /
analyzed: bsgrub bya la nyes pa bsgo ba'i phyir bsam gtan gyis khyad par byas te /

analyzed: de yang dang po bla ma la smod pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa'i gang zag de'i lag par ma chags sta re dang tho ba ste gtun shing bsnams par bsams la 'og nas 'byung ba'i bsam gtan rab tu bya zhes so // de nyid gsungs ba /
translated: Moreover, first one should imagine that the person who has the intention of reviling the guru and so forth holds an unattached axe and a hammer, that is, a club, in his hands, and one should perform the meditation that will be explained below.🔽That itself is stated [in the following]:

original: de las zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de las zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: From that and so forth.

original: mkha' dbyings sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yongs su gang bar bsams la gdug pa de sta re dang gtun shing gis thams cad bsad par bsam mo //
analyzed: mkha' dbyings sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yongs su gang bar bsams la gdug pa de sta re dang gtun shing gis thams cad bsad par bsam mo //
translated: Having imagined the sky-treasury filled with all buddhas, one should imagine that the evil one is killed by the axe and the club.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis gang bar bsams nas /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis gang bar bsams nas /
translated: Again, having imagined it filled with all bodhisattvas,

original: gong ma ltar yang bsad par bsam mo //
analyzed: gong ma ltar yang bsad par bsam mo //
translated: one should imagine that [the evil one] is killed as before.

original: de ltar lan gsum du byas nas der mtshan ma bor te sangs rgyas gnod byed kyi dgra rnams dran pa thob nas 'gyod cing skyabs med pas skrag cing 'jigs pas sems dkrugs par sngags mkhan gyis bsams na /
analyzed: de ltar lan gsum du byas nas der mtshan ma bor te sangs rgyas gnod byed kyi dgra rnams dran pa thob nas 'gyod cing skyabs med pas skrag cing 'jigs pas sems dkrugs par sngags mkhan gyis bsams na /
translated: Having done this three times, the magician should imagine that the signs are cast away, that the enemies who harm the Buddha regain their memory, and that they are frightened and terrified, their minds disturbed, because they have no refuge and are full of remorse.

original: snying rje chen po'i khro bo bskyed nas las byas na 'chi bar 'gyur ba gdon mi za zhes so //
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i khro bo bskyed nas las byas na 'chi bar 'gyur ba gdon mi za zhes so //
translated: If he performs the rite, having generated the wrathful one of great compassion, there is no doubt that they will die.

original: bsam gtan las byung ba'i sbyor ba gzhan gsungs pa /
analyzed: bsam gtan las byung ba'i sbyor ba gzhan gsungs pa /
translated: Another application arising from contemplation is stated:

original: srin po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: srin po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The cannibal and so forth.

original: bdud rtsi 'khyil ba'i rnal 'byor pas srung ma bral ba'i bsgrub bya me la gnas pa la rang gi sngags brjod pa las byung ba'i srin po dang / khro bo sna tshogs pa gtum zhing mi bzad pa spros pas bcings shing rdeg pa la sogs pas skrag par bsams na 'chi'o zhes so //
analyzed: bdud rtsi 'khyil ba'i rnal 'byor pas srung ma bral ba'i bsgrub bya me la gnas pa la rang gi sngags brjod pa las byung ba'i srin po dang / khro bo sna tshogs pa gtum zhing mi bzad pa spros pas bcings shing rdeg pa la sogs pas skrag par bsams na 'chi'o zhes so //
translated: The practitioner of Amṛtakuṇḍali should imagine that the one to be subdued, who is free from protection, stands in fire, and that he is bound, beaten, and so forth by the emission of various fierce and terrible cannibals and wrathful ones arisen from the recitation of his mantra. He will die.

original: de bzhin du de las 'phros pa'i 'ug pa dang / khva dang bya rog dang ring du sgra 'byin pa'i wa la sogs pas gtses shing skrag par bsams na 'jig ces so //
analyzed: de bzhin du de las 'phros pa'i 'ug pa dang / khva dang bya rog dang ring du sgra 'byin pa'i wa la sogs pas gtses shing skrag par bsams na 'jig ces so //
translated: Likewise, if one thinks that he is tormented and frightened by the owl, the crow, the raven, the jackal that howls in the distance, and so on, who have come forth from that, he is destroyed.

original: de bzhin du de las 'phros pa'i sbrul nag rab tu khro ba mgo brgya yod pa de re re lce gnyis mche ba'i phreng ba gnyis yod pa 'jigs pa dag kyang 'jigs par byed pa gdug pa thams cad kyi dam tshig de bsgrub bya'i dpral bar bzung bar
analyzed: de bzhin du de las 'phros pa'i sbrul nag rab tu khro ba mgo brgya yod pa de re re lce gnyis mche ba'i phreng ba gnyis yod pa 'jigs pa dag kyang 'jigs par byed pa gdug pa thams cad kyi dam tshig de bsgrub bya'i dpral bar bzung bar
translated: Likewise, if one thinks that the one who is to be tormented is seized on the forehead by the very angry, hundred-headed black snakes, each with two tongues and two rows of fangs, who have come forth from that, he is destroyed.

original: bsams na 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: bsams na 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: Thus, it is said, he is destroyed.

original: phyogs bcu'i sems can ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpar @98a * //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sems can ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpar @98a * //
translated: The beings of the ten directions are the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: gyur pa'o // de la gong ma ltar bsgrub bya la 'tshe zhing gnod pa ni bsgrub bya'o //
analyzed: gyur pa'o // de la gong ma ltar bsgrub bya la 'tshe zhing gnod pa ni bsgrub bya'o //
translated: The one to be tormented is the one who torments and harms the one above, as before.

original: de 'jigs par byed pa la 'di bskul ba'i cho ga yin no zhes so //
analyzed: de 'jigs par byed pa la 'di bskul ba'i cho ga yin no zhes so //
translated: This is the rite of inciting him to frighten him.

original: de bzhin du bdag gi lag na gnas pa'i tho ba rab tu drag pos bsgrub bya'i snying gar brdegs par bsams na dgra'i srog med par 'gyur zhes pa'o //🔽de bzhin du lag na gnas pa'i rdo rje dang sta re la sogs pas bsgrub bya'i snying gar brdegs par bsams na dgra'i srog med par 'gyur zhes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag gi lag na gnas pa'i tho ba rab tu drag pos bsgrub bya'i snying gar brdegs par bsams na dgra'i srog med par 'gyur zhes pa'o // de bzhin du lag na gnas pa'i rdo rje dang sta re la sogs pas bsgrub bya'i snying gar brdegs par bsams na dgra'i srog med par 'gyur zhes so //
translated: Likewise, if one imagines that one strikes the heart of the victim with a hammer held in one's hand, the enemy's life will be destroyed.🔽Likewise, if one imagines that one strikes the heart of the victim with a vajra, axe, and so forth held in one's hand, the enemy's life will be destroyed.

original: de bzhin du lag na gnas pa'i rdo rje dang sta re la sogs pas bsgrub bya gshag cing gtub par bsams na rdo rje sems dpa' drag po yang 'chi na gzhan lta ci smos zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lag na gnas pa'i rdo rje dang sta re la sogs pas bsgrub bya gshag cing gtub par bsams na rdo rje sems dpa' drag po yang 'chi na gzhan lta ci smos zhes pa'o //
translated: Likewise, if one imagines that one cuts and chops the victim with a vajra, axe, and so forth held in one's hand, even Vajrasattva will die, to say nothing of others.

original: de ltar rnam par gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas gal te bsgrub bya gzhan gyi sngags dang lhas bsrung ba byas pa yang srid pas de dang dbral ba'i cho ga gsungs pa /

translated: Thus, if the yogin who is situated in that way should imagine that the victim is protected by the mantras and deities of others, he should perform the rite of separating him from them.

original: bsrung ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsrung ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: [The Bhagavān] declares the rite of protection, and so forth.

original: de la gnod pa bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir rnal 'byor gzhan gyis dang po'am phyis sngags rnams dang de las byung ba'i lha rnams te /

analyzed: rdo rje phung po zhes pa ni bsgrub bya'i phung po la sogs pa dang dbyer med pa'i lha ste /
translated: The “vajra aggregates” are the deities who are inseparable from the aggregates, etc. , which are to be accomplished.

analyzed: de ji tsam du sems can de'i lus kyi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa la de'i nyes pa bsgos te /
translated: To the extent that they abide in the body maṇḍala of that sentient being, they are smeared with his faults.

analyzed: des kyang gnang nas shin tu khros pas bsgrub bya gsod par bsams nas de phyung la bdag nyid 'jug pa la sogs pa'o //

original: des mnyes par byas par 'gyur te gzhan du mnyes par gyur pa /
analyzed: des mnyes par byas par 'gyur te gzhan du mnyes par gyur pa /
translated: One should please them in this way, not otherwise.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:🔽Having visualized the maṇḍala

analyzed: gang zhig bsgrub bya'i lus la yang // dkyil 'khor rnam par bsgom byas te //
translated: in the body of the one to be accomplished,🔽one should smear the faults

analyzed: de @98b yi lus gnas 'khor lo la // de yi nyes pa bsgo bar bya //
translated: of the wheel that abides in his body.

original: de ni 'byung bar rnam bsgoms la //🔽zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni 'byung bar rnam bsgoms la // zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Then, having visualized the emergence,🔽one should draw him out with the hook gesture.

original: sbyor ba'i nus pa gsungs pa //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i nus pa gsungs pa //
translated: The ability of the application is stated:

original: ston pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The teacher, etc.”

original: sangs rgyas ni rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Buddha is permanence, etc.

original: rdo rje 'dzin ni de nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin ni de nyid do //
translated: The vajra holder is just that.

original: rdo rje chos ni 'od dpag med do //
analyzed: rdo rje chos ni 'od dpag med do //
translated: Vajra Dharma is Amitābha.

original: rdo rje yang mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje yang mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: Vajra is Akṣhobhya.

original: de rnams kyang bsam gtan sbyor ba des 'chi bar 'gyur zhes so //
analyzed: de rnams kyang bsam gtan sbyor ba des 'chi bar 'gyur zhes so //
translated: Those are the meditative absorptions.

original: gnyis su med pa'i tshad mas dngos po stobs su gnas pa la gang ji lta ba bzhin du bskul ba de kho na bzhin du 'byung ngo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i tshad mas dngos po stobs su gnas pa la gang ji lta ba bzhin du bskul ba de kho na bzhin du 'byung ngo zhes pa'o //
translated: By the power of the valid cognition of nonduality, whatever is urged in accordance with the power of fact will arise just as it is.

original: rdo rje khro bo ni bdud rtsi 'khyil ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje khro bo ni bdud rtsi 'khyil ba'o //
translated: Vajra wrath is Amṛtakuṇḍali.

original: de yang de'i ngo bo las mi 'da' bas na dam tshig khro bo ste rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: de yang de'i ngo bo las mi 'da' bas na dam tshig khro bo ste rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: Since he does not transgress his nature, he is the wrathful one of sacred pledge, that is, Mahāvajradhara.

original: dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid kyis dag par gsungs pa //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid kyis dag par gsungs pa //
translated: It is said that things are pure by nature.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, Śākyamuni, etc.

original: lus ngag yid gsum phyin ci ma log pas na thub pa chen po'o //
analyzed: lus ngag yid gsum phyin ci ma log pas na thub pa chen po'o //
translated: He is the great sage because his body, speech, and mind are unerring.

original: gzhan ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzhan ni bshad zin to //
translated: The rest has been explained.

original: ngo bo nyid dag ces pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa ste byed pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dag ces pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa ste byed pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Pure by nature refers to ultimate truth, which is not a creator.

original: de nyid rdo rje theg pa bla na med pa ste de la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje theg pa bla na med pa ste de la gnas pa'o //
translated: That is the unexcelled Vajrayāna, in which he abides.

original: de bas na ma skyes pa'i chos rnams la zhes te kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na ma skyes pa'i chos rnams la zhes te kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis ma skyes pa ste /
translated: Therefore, with regard to unarisen phenomena, i.e., unarisen by way of the imagined nature,

original: de la rgyal ba rnams kyis gnyis su med pa'i tshul gyis gsod pa la sogs pa skye bar bstan zhes so //
analyzed: de la rgyal ba rnams kyis gnyis su med pa'i tshul gyis gsod pa la sogs pa skye bar bstan zhes so //
translated: the Victors have taught the arising of killing, etc. by way of the nondual.

original: da ni lha gang yang rung ba'i rnal 'byor pas rdzas dang ldan par las phran tshegs su gsungs pa de la zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ni lha gang yang rung ba'i rnal 'byor pas rdzas dang ldan par las phran tshegs su gsungs pa de la zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, with regard to the minor rites taught in the tantras for the yogī of any deity, he says “in that” and so on.

original: las phran tshegs zhes pa ni bri ba la sogs pa'i bya ba gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las phran tshegs zhes pa ni bri ba la sogs pa'i bya ba gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Minor rites” are so called because writing, etc. are the primary actions.

original: bsam gtan dang 'brel bas na rdo rje gsang ba'o zhes so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang 'brel bas na rdo rje gsang ba'o zhes so //
translated: “Vajra secret” is so called because it is connected with meditative stabilization.🔽There, by the recitation of KHAM inserted between the three syllables, one should enchant a grinding stone or charnel ground ash one hundred and eight times.

original: de la yi ge gsum gyi bar du bcug pa'i kham gi bzlas pa yis rdo rgyus sam dur khrod kyi sol ba la brgya rtsa brgyad pa btab pas sprul mi sdug pa 'jigs par byed pa /
analyzed: de la yi ge gsum gyi bar du bcug pa'i kham gi bzlas pa yis rdo rgyus sam dur khrod kyi sol ba la brgya rtsa brgyad pa btab pas sprul mi sdug pa 'jigs par byed pa /
translated: One should make a terrifying, ugly snake,

original: nag po'i 'od 'bar ba sems 'khrugs shing khro ba lce gnyis pa /
analyzed: nag po'i 'od 'bar ba sems 'khrugs shing khro ba lce gnyis pa /
translated: black, blazing, disturbing the mind, angry, with a forked tongue,

original: mche ba'i phreng ba btags pa dur khrod kyi sa la bri'o //
analyzed: mche ba'i phreng ba btags pa dur khrod kyi sa la bri'o //
translated: The garland of fangs is drawn on a charnel ground cloth.

original: de la 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pa ni gnas nas bskyod pa'i thabs bstan to //
analyzed: de la 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pa ni gnas nas bskyod pa'i thabs bstan to //
translated: The method of moving from that place is taught by there, this... and so forth.

original: de yang yi ge kham mi bzad par gyur pa'i dug gi rang bzhin sbrul de'i kha'i dbus na 'jug par bsams la de yang sreg pa'i @99a * //
analyzed: de yang yi ge kham mi bzad par gyur pa'i dug gi rang bzhin sbrul de'i kha'i dbus na 'jug par bsams la de yang sreg pa'i @99a * //
translated: Moreover, one should imagine that the snake, which is the nature of poison, becomes unbearable in the middle of the mouth of the KṢHA syllable.

original: me'i kha dog bzhin du dmar nag tu bsgoms na des de gnas de las 'gul bar gdon mi za zhes so //
analyzed: me'i kha dog bzhin du dmar nag tu bsgoms na des de gnas de las 'gul bar gdon mi za zhes so //
translated: If one meditates on that as red-black, like the color of a burning fire, there is no doubt that it will move from that place.

original: de la 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pas dug bkug nas 'dzin du gzhug pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: de la 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pas dug bkug nas 'dzin du gzhug pa'i thabs so //
translated: The method of summoning and binding the poison is taught by there, this... and so forth.

original: dug thams cad 'byin pa ni rang rang gi gnas las so //
analyzed: dug thams cad 'byin pa ni rang rang gi gnas las so //
translated: All poisons are extracted from their own places.

original: de yang de'i lce'i rtse mo yi ge hr'i: bsams nas //
analyzed: de yang de'i lce'i rtse mo yi ge hr'i: bsams nas //
translated: Moreover, one should imagine the syllable HRĪḤ at the tip of its tongue.

original: de'i 'od zer gyi lcags kyus rgyu rnam pa sna tshogs pa las byung ba'i dug khams gsum na gnas pa ji snyed pa bkug nas de yis bsdus nas khyer 'ongs nas de ma thag tu lce la thim par bsam mo //
analyzed: de'i 'od zer gyi lcags kyus rgyu rnam pa sna tshogs pa las byung ba'i dug khams gsum na gnas pa ji snyed pa bkug nas de yis bsdus nas khyer 'ongs nas de ma thag tu lce la thim par bsam mo //
translated: The iron hook of its light rays summons all the poisons that arise from various causes and exist in the three realms. Having gathered them, it brings them and they immediately dissolve into the tongue.

original: des rten gyi mi bzad dug ni byang ba ste med par byas nas so //
analyzed: des rten gyi mi bzad dug ni byang ba ste med par byas nas so //
translated: By that, the unbearable poison of the support is purified, that is, made non-existent.

original: de bsgrub bya'i dpral bar mche bas phug nas lce des reg ma thag tu mi 'chi ba'i dogs pa med ces so //
analyzed: de bsgrub bya'i dpral bar mche bas phug nas lce des reg ma thag tu mi 'chi ba'i dogs pa med ces so //
translated: Having pierced the forehead of the one to be benefited with its fangs, there is no doubt that one will die immediately upon being touched by that tongue.

original: gdug pa'i srog chags gzhan la yang cho ga des bya bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: gdug pa'i srog chags gzhan la yang cho ga des bya bar gsungs pa /
translated: It is said that one should do the same with other poisonous creatures.

original: sdig pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The sinful and so forth.

original: sogs kyi sgras bsdus pa sre mo dang rta glang la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs kyi sgras bsdus pa sre mo dang rta glang la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word and so forth includes the mongoose, horse, elephant, and so forth.

original: sbrul rnams sna tshogs pa la zhes pa ni chu sbrul dang / rlung sbrul dang / kha dog tha dad pa'i sbrul rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: sbrul rnams sna tshogs pa la zhes pa ni chu sbrul dang / rlung sbrul dang / kha dog tha dad pa'i sbrul rnams bsdu'o //
translated: The various snakes includes water snakes, wind snakes, and snakes of different colors.

original: de rnams yang gong du gsungs pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis /
analyzed: de rnams yang gong du gsungs pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis /
translated: Those are also by the characteristic arisen from the above yoga.

original: cho ga bzhin du rab tu bya //
analyzed: cho ga bzhin du rab tu bya //
translated: One should perform in accordance with the rite.

original: zhes te / bri ba dang / bskul ba dang 'dzin du gzhug pa la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: zhes te / bri ba dang / bskul ba dang 'dzin du gzhug pa la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: One should draw, incite, cause to hold, and so forth.

original: da ni rdo rje gsum gyi rnal 'byor gyis dug bsal ba'i cho ga gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni rdo rje gsum gyi rnal 'byor gyis dug bsal ba'i cho ga gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the rite of removing poison by means of the yoga of the three vajras is stated:

original: de la 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therein, this is the procedure, etc.

original: ji lta bu bzhin du byas pa'i rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas lag pa g-yas pa aom las byung ba'i rdo rje 'khor lo dkar po rtsibs brgyad pa 'od zer gyi tshogs dang ldan pa bsams nas /
analyzed: ji lta bu bzhin du byas pa'i rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas lag pa g-yas pa aom las byung ba'i rdo rje 'khor lo dkar po rtsibs brgyad pa 'od zer gyi tshogs dang ldan pa bsams nas /
translated: A yogin of Vairocana who has performed as prescribed should imagine a white vajra wheel with eight spokes arisen from om in his right hand, endowed with a mass of light rays.

original: de'i lte ba la yang aom 'od zer dang ldan pa bsams 'od zer des nye ba'i dug dang / rdo rje la sogs pa mi bzad pa'i dug gis zin pa'i lus las dug nag po drang nas /
analyzed: de'i lte ba la yang aom 'od zer dang ldan pa bsams 'od zer des nye ba'i dug dang / rdo rje la sogs pa mi bzad pa'i dug gis zin pa'i lus las dug nag po drang nas /
translated: He should imagine an om endowed with light rays in the center of that, and the light rays draw out the black poison from the body afflicted by the unbearable poison of the vajra, etc.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings rdo rje dkyil 'khor du gtor bar byed ces pa //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings rdo rje dkyil 'khor du gtor bar byed ces pa //
translated: The sky is the vajra maṇḍala.

original: de nas nag po byug pa'i sar 'od zer dkar po 'jug pas zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas nag po byug pa'i sar 'od zer dkar po 'jug pas zhi bar bya'o //
translated: Then, in the place of the black ointment, one should enter with white light rays, and thus pacify.

original: mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor bas dug gso ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor bas dug gso ba gsungs pa /
translated: The pacification of poison is taught for one who is a yogin of Akṣobhya.

original: de la 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: With regard to therein, this, and so on,

original: mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor dang @99b ldan pas bsgrub bya dug gis zin pa'i snying gar h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje dkar po h'um dang ldan pa 'od kyi sprin bzhin du 'bar ba 'od zer de yang zla ba'i 'od bzhin du bsil bar bsam mo //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor dang @99b ldan pas bsgrub bya dug gis zin pa'i snying gar h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje dkar po h'um dang ldan pa 'od kyi sprin bzhin du 'bar ba 'od zer de yang zla ba'i 'od bzhin du bsil bar bsam mo //
translated: one who is endowed with the yoga of Akṣobhya should imagine that at the heart of the victim seized by poison, a white vajra arises from hūṃ, endowed with hūṃ, blazing like a cloud of light, and that light, like the light of the moon, is cool.

original: de'i 'od kyis lus khyab par byas nas dug thams cad snying ga dang / lkog ma dang / dbral ba dang / mgo'i gnas bzhi dag tu bsdus nas lan gsum gyi bar du bsams nas kyang thams cad snying gar bsdus nas kha dog nag por skyug pa'i tshul du byung bdag tu bsams nas /
analyzed: de'i 'od kyis lus khyab par byas nas dug thams cad snying ga dang / lkog ma dang / dbral ba dang / mgo'i gnas bzhi dag tu bsdus nas lan gsum gyi bar du bsams nas kyang thams cad snying gar bsdus nas kha dog nag por skyug pa'i tshul du byung bdag tu bsams nas /
translated: Having pervaded the body with its light, one should imagine that all the poisons are gathered into the four places of the heart, throat, forehead, and head, and having imagined that three times, one should imagine that all are gathered into the heart and emerge in the manner of vomiting, black in color.

original: nam mkha'i khams gang ba'i dug kyang med par byed na bsgrub bya'i lus lta ci smos pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams gang ba'i dug kyang med par byed na bsgrub bya'i lus lta ci smos pa'o //
translated: If one can destroy the poisons that fill the realm of space, what need is there to mention the body of the victim?

original: snang ba mtha' yas kyi rnal 'byor bas nye ba'i dug 'byin pa gsungs pa /🔽de la 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba mtha' yas kyi rnal 'byor bas nye ba'i dug 'byin pa gsungs pa / de la 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The near-evacuation of poison is taught for the practitioner of Amitābha.🔽[The text] says, “In that regard, this is . . .” and so forth.

original: de las gzhan pa'i zhes pa ni rdo dang g-yan pa dang / sha bkra la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i zhes pa ni rdo dang g-yan pa dang / sha bkra la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Other than that” refers to stones, scabs, leprosy, and so forth.

original: bsams pa tsam gyis zhes pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du byas pa'i snang ba mtha' yas kyi rnal 'byor pas lag pa g-yas par a'a:las byung ba'i padma chen po 'dab ma brgyad pa zla ba bzhin du dri ma med par dkar po bsams nas de'i dbus su
analyzed: bsams pa tsam gyis zhes pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du byas pa'i snang ba mtha' yas kyi rnal 'byor pas lag pa g-yas par a'a:las byung ba'i padma chen po 'dab ma brgyad pa zla ba bzhin du dri ma med par dkar po bsams nas de'i dbus su
translated: The phrase merely by thinking is for one who is a yogi of Amitabha who has performed the rite as it is, and who has imagined in his right hand a great eight-petaled lotus arisen from A, white like the moon, stainless.

original: 'dug pa a'a:'od zer lnga rdzogs par bsam mo //
analyzed: 'dug pa a'a:'od zer lnga rdzogs par bsam mo //
translated: In the center of that he should imagine an A, complete with five light-rays.

original: des nye ba'i dug rnams bya ba'o //
analyzed: des nye ba'i dug rnams bya ba'o //
translated: That is the rite for the near-poisons.

original: ji lta zhe na sdud pa ni dam tshig gang ces te /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na sdud pa ni dam tshig gang ces te /
translated: How so? The verse begins, The gathering of the pledge...

original: 'od zer gyis sdud pa na dug dang bcas pas nag po yin la /
analyzed: 'od zer gyis sdud pa na dug dang bcas pas nag po yin la /
translated: When the light-rays gather, they are black because they gather the poisons.

original: bskul ba na ni dkar po mdog ces te gzhan du spro ba na dug spangs pas na dkar po ste /
analyzed: bskul ba na ni dkar po mdog ces te gzhan du spro ba na dug spangs pas na dkar po ste /
translated: When they are urged, they are white-colored, because when they emanate elsewhere, they are white because they abandon the poisons.

original: gang du de ltar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang du de ltar shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know it thus.

original: de bas dug dbyung ba'i cho ga 'di ni sangs rgyas dri med kyi bsam gtan gyi gnas ni gsang ba'o zhes so //
analyzed: de bas dug dbyung ba'i cho ga 'di ni sangs rgyas dri med kyi bsam gtan gyi gnas ni gsang ba'o zhes so //
translated: Therefore, this rite for removing poison is the secret place of the meditation of the stainless Buddha.

original: da ni dbyung ba'i sngags kyis nad bsal ba'i cho ga gsungs pa de la 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ni dbyung ba'i sngags kyis nad bsal ba'i cho ga gsungs pa de la 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, the rite of removing sickness with the mantra of expulsion is taught, beginning with “Here is the mantra of the three vajras. ”

original: phyi'i nad ni 'byung ba ring thung las byung ba'o //
analyzed: phyi'i nad ni 'byung ba ring thung las byung ba'o //
translated: External sickness arises from the elements, long and short.

original: nang gi nad ni las las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi nad ni las las skyes pa'o //
translated: Internal sickness arises from karma.

original: de gso ba ni rdo rje gsum gyi snying po'i sngags te yi ge'i tshig go //
analyzed: de gso ba ni rdo rje gsum gyi snying po'i sngags te yi ge'i tshig go //
translated: The cure for that is the mantra of the essence of the three vajras, the words of the syllables.

original: yi ge'i tshig ni gang 'dod pa zhes pa ni dzika la sogs par rang gis blangs pa ni 'dod pas te /
analyzed: yi ge'i tshig ni gang 'dod pa zhes pa ni dzika la sogs par rang gis blangs pa ni 'dod pas te /
translated: “ The words of the syllables, whatever one desires” means that one takes up jik and so on by oneself with desire.

original: de la dad pa bskyed na yon tan thob pas de'i sbyor bas de 'dra ba'i gzugs rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i gzugs @100a * //🔽bsgom par bya zhes so //
analyzed: de la dad pa bskyed na yon tan thob pas de'i sbyor bas de 'dra ba'i gzugs rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i gzugs @100a * // bsgom par bya zhes so //
translated: If one generates faith in that, one obtains the qualities. By the application of that, one should meditate on a form like that, the form of Vairocana and so on.

original: de nas nad pa mdun du bzhag la /🔽nad kyi rdo rje bskul ba yis //
analyzed: de nas nad pa mdun du bzhag la / nad kyi rdo rje bskul ba yis //
translated: Then, having placed the sick person in front,🔽“one should summon the sickness vajra”

original: zhes te rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor bas aom a'a: 'dzin dzika che ge mo'i nad aa pa na ya h'um zhes brjod pas bskul bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes te rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor bas aom a'a: 'dzin dzika che ge mo'i nad aa pa na ya h'um zhes brjod pas bskul bar bya'o //
translated: means that one should summon with the Vairocana yoga, saying oṃ āḥ jik such and such a person’s sickness apanaya hūṃ.

original: gzhan rnams la yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams la yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand the others in the same way.

original: nad de rnams kyang spre'u dang 'dra ba'am /
analyzed: nad de rnams kyang spre'u dang 'dra ba'am /
translated: Those sicknesses are like a monkey,

original: khyi rkang gsum pa'am /
analyzed: khyi rkang gsum pa'am /
translated: or a three-legged dog,

original: yi dags gcer bu'i gzugs su bsgyur ba'i lus dang ngag dang sems las byung bar bsams la gzhi dang bral ba'o //🔽de nas bdag gi lag na gnas pa'i 'khor lo'am /
analyzed: yi dags gcer bu'i gzugs su bsgyur ba'i lus dang ngag dang sems las byung bar bsams la gzhi dang bral ba'o // de nas bdag gi lag na gnas pa'i 'khor lo'am /
translated: or a hungry ghost, or a naked form, arisen from body, speech, and mind, and are without a basis.🔽Then, if one meditates on the wheel or vajra, etc.

original: rdo rje la sogs pas btags par bsgoms na rdo rje go 'phang ste /
analyzed: rdo rje la sogs pas btags par bsgoms na rdo rje go 'phang ste /
translated: in one’s hand, the vajra level,

original: rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor la gnas pas /
analyzed: rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor la gnas pas /
translated: one who abides in the yoga of one’s deity

original: lus dang ngag sems las mi 'da' bas na dam tshig ste nad kyi gzugs so //
analyzed: lus dang ngag sems las mi 'da' bas na dam tshig ste nad kyi gzugs so //
translated: is not beyond body, speech, and mind, and so is a commitment, the form of the sickness.

original: phyag mtshan des phye mar brlag par bsgom zhes so //
analyzed: phyag mtshan des phye mar brlag par bsgom zhes so //
translated: One should meditate on the pulverization by that symbolic implement.

original: de ltar las byas na bde bar gshegs pa sras dang bcas pas byin gyis rlob par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar las byas na bde bar gshegs pa sras dang bcas pas byin gyis rlob par gsungs pa /
translated: If one performs the rite in that way, it is said that the Sugatas together with their sons will bless one.

original: 'on tang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on tang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “ Even so” and so forth.

original: lus dang ngag sems rdo rje las //
analyzed: lus dang ngag sems rdo rje las //
translated: From the vajra of body, speech, and mind,

original: zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa kha dog nag por bsams pa'i rdo rje gsum las sangs rgyas sprin dag 'phros par bsam mo //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa kha dog nag por bsams pa'i rdo rje gsum las sangs rgyas sprin dag 'phros par bsam mo //
translated: This means that one imagines that clouds of buddhas emanate from the three vajras of Vairochana and so forth, imagined as black in color.

original: de lta bu rdo rje rgyal po sprin gyis bsgrub bya de'i nad las thar par bsgom zhes so //
analyzed: de lta bu rdo rje rgyal po sprin gyis bsgrub bya de'i nad las thar par bsgom zhes so //
translated: One should meditate that the clouds of vajra kings liberate the one to be liberated from illness.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs 'phros pa rnams kyang nad de la khros par bsams la de rnams kyi lag na gnas pa'i mtshan mas nad bcom nas nad kyi gzugs rnams 'chi bar byed pa'o//
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs 'phros pa rnams kyang nad de la khros par bsams la de rnams kyi lag na gnas pa'i mtshan mas nad bcom nas nad kyi gzugs rnams 'chi bar byed pa'o//
translated: One imagines that the emanated forms of the buddhas and Vajrasattva in the ten directions are enraged at that illness. The signs that are in their hands destroy the illness and kill the forms of the illness.

original: de nas yang thams cad kha dog nag por bsams nas 'od zer dbab pa dang / dbang bskur ba la sogs pa zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas yang thams cad kha dog nag por bsams nas 'od zer dbab pa dang / dbang bskur ba la sogs pa zhi bar bya'o //
translated: Then, imagining everything as black in color, one should pacify the descent of light rays, conferral of initiation, and so forth.

original: de bas na bsam gtan gyi sbyor ba des las las skyes pa'i nad myong bar nges pa yang nyi ma bdun du brgya rtsa brgyad thun bzhi la bzlas pas 'jig par 'gyur zhes so//
analyzed: de bas na bsam gtan gyi sbyor ba des las las skyes pa'i nad myong bar nges pa yang nyi ma bdun du brgya rtsa brgyad thun bzhi la bzlas pas 'jig par 'gyur zhes so//
translated: Therefore, by that yoga of meditative stabilization, even if one is certain to experience a disease born from karma, one should repeat the mantra one hundred and eight times in four sessions for seven days, and it will be destroyed.

original: rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas kyang sbyor ba de kho nas bsal ba sungs pa /
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas kyang sbyor ba de kho nas bsal ba sungs pa /
translated: The yoga of Ratnasaṃbhava and so forth is also said to be the same yoga.

original: yang na zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Or” and so forth.

original: bdag gis sngags rgyal gyis zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa'i sngags ratna dhri ka la sogs pas kyang @100b zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sngags rgyal gyis zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa'i sngags ratna dhri ka la sogs pas kyang @100b zhes pa'o //
translated: “By the king of mantras” means that the mantras of Ratnasaṃbhava and so forth, such as ratnadhṛk and so forth, are also the same.

original: rdo rje bsam gtan cho gas so //
analyzed: rdo rje bsam gtan cho gas so //
translated: “By the rite of vajra meditative stabilization”

original: zhes pa ni gong ma ltar mngon spyod kyi cho gas nad gzhom pa dang zhi bas nad gso ba la sogs pa bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gong ma ltar mngon spyod kyi cho gas nad gzhom pa dang zhi bas nad gso ba la sogs pa bya ba'o //
translated: means that one should destroy the disease by the rite of killing as before, and heal the disease by pacifying and so forth.

original: de ltar byas na 'di ni bsam gtan thams cad de /
analyzed: de ltar byas na 'di ni bsam gtan thams cad de /
translated: If one does it in that way, this is all meditative stabilizations,

original: lha thams cad kyis 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pas na dam tshig shin tu 'da' dka' ba'o zhes so //
analyzed: lha thams cad kyis 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pas na dam tshig shin tu 'da' dka' ba'o zhes so //
translated: and since it is not to be transgressed by any deity, it is the pledge that is very difficult to transgress.

original: da ni brtan par gyur pa'i rnal 'byor pas bar ma'i skabs su 'dod pa'i 'bras bur rnyed pa'i mtshan ma rmi lam la sogs pa grub pa'i mtshan ma bkug nas sgrub pa po la snang bar mdzad pas na ye shes kyi 'od chen po'o //
analyzed: da ni brtan par gyur pa'i rnal 'byor pas bar ma'i skabs su 'dod pa'i 'bras bur rnyed pa'i mtshan ma rmi lam la sogs pa grub pa'i mtshan ma bkug nas sgrub pa po la snang bar mdzad pas na ye shes kyi 'od chen po'o //
translated: Now, the yogi who is firm, having summoned the signs of accomplishment, such as dreams, which are the results of desire found in the intermediate state, and having made them appear to the practitioner, is the great light of gnosis.

original: des 'dod chags kyi lam gyis 'dod pa'i 'bras bu rnyed pas na 'dod dang thar pa rdo rje che'o //
analyzed: des 'dod chags kyi lam gyis 'dod pa'i 'bras bu rnyed pas na 'dod dang thar pa rdo rje che'o //
translated: Since he finds the result of desire by the path of desire, he is the great vajra of desire and liberation.

original: chos rnams rmi lam lta bu ni //
analyzed: chos rnams rmi lam lta bu ni //
translated: All phenomena are like a dream.

original: zhes pa ni chos thams cad rmi lam ltar mngon sum bzhin du snang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni chos thams cad rmi lam ltar mngon sum bzhin du snang bar byed pa'o //
translated: This means that all phenomena are made to appear like a dream, as if directly perceived.

original: snang ba de nyid kyang ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: snang ba de nyid kyang ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa ste /
translated: That appearance itself is not produced by an antidote, nor is it unproduced by nature.

original: gnyen po skyes nas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen po skyes nas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not produced by an antidote, nor is it unproduced by nature.

original: de bas rmi lam lta bur snang bas na ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa ste /
analyzed: de bas rmi lam lta bur snang bas na ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa ste /
translated: Therefore, since it appears like a dream, it is pure by nature.

original: de'i ngang las kun rdzob tu rmi lam la sogs pa'i mtshan ma 'khrul pa'i rdo rje ste /
analyzed: de'i ngang las kun rdzob tu rmi lam la sogs pa'i mtshan ma 'khrul pa'i rdo rje ste /
translated: From that state, the conventional, deluded signs such as dreams are the vajra.

original: de rab tu gsungs zhes so //
analyzed: de rab tu gsungs zhes so //
translated: That is taught.

original: sgrub pa po gang gis mthong zhe na /
analyzed: sgrub pa po gang gis mthong zhe na /

analyzed: nyin mtshan du sgrub pa po ste /
translated: The adept sees it day and night,🔽and by the second [repetition] he sees it almost always in the state of sleep, which is blessed by the Tathagata.🔽[The adept] should distinguish the signs of the latent impressions of mental activity.🔽[The adept] should distinguish the signs of the latent impressions of mental activity.🔽[The adept] should distinguish the signs of the latent impressions of mental activity.
