original: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rang gi gzugs mthong ba dang / grags chen rdo rje gsang ba ste /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rang gi gzugs mthong ba dang / grags chen rdo rje gsang ba ste /
translated: In a dream, one sees oneself as the nirmāṇakāya endowed with the major and minor marks, and one sees oneself as a great being making offerings to oneself as the lord of the three realms.

original: khro bo rnams kyi gzugs su mthong ba dang / rmi lam na byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor lo can ni spyan ma la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: khro bo rnams kyi gzugs su mthong ba dang / rmi lam na byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor lo can ni spyan ma la sogs pa ste /
translated: Seeing the forms of the wrathful ones, and in dreams, the wheel of the bodhisattvas, namely Locanā and so on,🔽and seeing those and the great buddhas such as Akṣobhya and so on, one should pay homage.

original: de rnams dang rtag pa la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas chen po phyag 'tshal bar mthong nas lus ngag sems kyi mthu las bskyed pa'i dngos grub rdo rje gsum 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams dang rtag pa la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas chen po phyag 'tshal bar mthong nas lus ngag sems kyi mthu las bskyed pa'i dngos grub rdo rje gsum 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: One will attain the powers of body, speech, and mind, and the powers of the three vajras will be accomplished.

original: gzhan yang rmi lam na rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i lha'i bu mo yid du 'ong ba dang de bzhin du mi'i khye'u dang bu mo rgyan dang ldan pa mthong na thun mong gi dngos grub gang yang rung ba thob par gyur pa'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rmi lam na rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i lha'i bu mo yid du 'ong ba dang de bzhin du mi'i khye'u dang bu mo rgyan dang ldan pa mthong na thun mong gi dngos grub gang yang rung ba thob par gyur pa'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: Moreover, in a dream, if one sees a beautiful celestial maiden adorned with all ornaments, and likewise a human boy or girl adorned with ornaments, this is a sign of attaining any of the common powers.

original: rmi lam na phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas rang rang gi zhing ni gnas pa mthong ste /
analyzed: rmi lam na phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas rang rang gi zhing ni gnas pa mthong ste /
translated: In a dream, one sees the buddhas of the ten directions in their own buddha fields.

original: de rnams kyang bdag la thugs dgyes par gyur nas zab cing rgya che ba'i chos kyi mdzod yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa mthong ba dang / rmi lam na sprul pa'i sku chos kyi 'khor lo lan bcu gnyis la sogs pa'i tshul du bskor ba /
analyzed: de rnams kyang bdag la thugs dgyes par gyur nas zab cing rgya che ba'i chos kyi mdzod yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa mthong ba dang / rmi lam na sprul pa'i sku chos kyi 'khor lo lan bcu gnyis la sogs pa'i tshul du bskor ba /
translated: In dreams, the nirmāṇakāya turns the wheel of Dharma twelve times and so forth.

original: lha dang klu dang / gnod sbyin la sogs pa'i sems can thams cad yongs su bskor ba de bsam gtan rdo rje la gnas pa dam tshig sngon du 'gro bas mthong bar 'gyur zhes te /
analyzed: lha dang klu dang / gnod sbyin la sogs pa'i sems can thams cad yongs su bskor ba de bsam gtan rdo rje la gnas pa dam tshig sngon du 'gro bas mthong bar 'gyur zhes te /
translated: All sentient beings, such as gods, nāgas, and yakṣas, are completely surrounded by the one who abides in the vajra of meditative concentration, preceded by samaya.

original: gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: This is seen, but not by others.

original: gzhan yang rmi lam na sna tshogs kyi kun dga' ra ba dang / skyed mos tshal dang gong ma ltar lha'i bu mo la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pas bsam gtan dang dam tshig can gyis mthong ste thun mong gi mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rmi lam na sna tshogs kyi kun dga' ra ba dang / skyed mos tshal dang gong ma ltar lha'i bu mo la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pas bsam gtan dang dam tshig can gyis mthong ste thun mong gi mtshan ma'o //
translated: Moreover, in dreams, the pleasure grove of various parks and divine maidens and so forth are blessed by the buddhas. This is seen by those with meditative concentration and samaya. This is the common sign.

original: rmi lam na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dag bdag la khams gsum chos kyi rgyal por dbang bskur zhing mthong na /
analyzed: rmi lam na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dag bdag la khams gsum chos kyi rgyal por dbang bskur zhing mthong na /
translated: If one sees in a dream that the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas consecrate oneself as the Dharma King of the three realms,

original: sku'i rig 'dzin la sogs pas g-yag rnga dkar po g-yob pa la sogs pa'i mchod pa byas par mthong ngo //
analyzed: sku'i rig 'dzin la sogs pas g-yag rnga dkar po g-yob pa la sogs pa'i mchod pa byas par mthong ngo //
translated: one sees the worship of the Knowledge-Being of the Body, etc., with the waving of white yak tails, etc.

original: rmi lam de rnams ni rdo rje las byung ba ste /
analyzed: rmi lam de rnams ni rdo rje las byung ba ste /
translated: These dreams are born from the vajra,

original: de'i byin gyis brlabs so //
analyzed: de'i byin gyis brlabs so //
translated: and are blessed by it.

original: mang por snang bas sna @101b tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: mang por snang bas sna @101b tshogs pa'o //
translated: Since they appear in many ways, they are various.

original: yid la byed pa dang log 'dren la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs pa lta bu ma yin pas na dri ma med pa ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa dang log 'dren la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs pa lta bu ma yin pas na dri ma med pa ste /
translated: Since they are not like those blessed by mental activity, wrong guides, etc., they are immaculate.

original: de sgrub pa pos mthong nas sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje las skyes pa ste sku gsum mo //
analyzed: de sgrub pa pos mthong nas sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje las skyes pa ste sku gsum mo //
translated: The adept sees them born from the vajra of Body, Speech, and Mind, i.e., the three bodies.

original: de nyid bla na med pa ste 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid bla na med pa ste 'grub pa'o //
translated: That itself is unsurpassed, i.e., accomplished.

original: gzhan yang rmi lam na gdol pa'i bu mo 'am khyi 'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang rmi lam na gdol pa'i bu mo 'am khyi 'am /
translated: Moreover, in a dream, one sees a candali girl, or a dog,🔽or a pig, or a cat, or a jackal, or a lion, or a tiger, or a bear, or a hyena, or a wolf, or a fox, or a monkey, or a crow, or a vulture, or a hawk, or a peacock, or a swan, or a parrot, or a mynah bird, or a cuckoo, or a dove, or a partridge, or a peacock, or a goose, or a crane, or a curlew, or a frog, or a fish, or a tortoise, or a snake, or a scorpion, or a spider, or a worm, or a mosquito, or a bee, or a fly, or a louse, or a flea, or a human, or a non-human, or a man, or a woman, or a boy, or a girl, or a demon, or a ghost, or a spirit, or a yaksha, or a rakshasa, or a pisacha, or a kumbhanda, or a vetala, or a preeta, or a kinnara, or a gandharva, or a naga, or a garuda, or a kimnara, or a mahoraga, or a kumbhakarṇa, or a kumbhīra, or a makaraka, or a shark, or a tortoise, or a crocodile, or a fish, or a frog, or a snake, or a scorpion, or a spider, or a worm, or a mosquito, or a bee, or a fly, or a louse, or a flea, or a human, or a non-human, or a man, or a woman,

original: rta rgod ma la sogs pa la sbyor bar rdo rje 'dzin pas te rnal 'byor pas mthong na rdo rje sems dpas sems kyi gnas na chos kyi sku ste rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba de 'grub par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rta rgod ma la sogs pa la sbyor bar rdo rje 'dzin pas te rnal 'byor pas mthong na rdo rje sems dpas sems kyi gnas na chos kyi sku ste rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba de 'grub par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: If the Vajra-Holder, i.e., the yogi, sees the coupling of a mare and so on, then the Dharmakaya, free from all conceptualization, is accomplished in the abode of the mind by Vajrasattva.

original: de ltar rmi lam gyi mtshan ma bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rmi lam gyi mtshan ma bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the dream signs,

original: da ni mtshan ma de la mngon par zhes pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni mtshan ma de la mngon par zhes pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: now, in order to dispel the over-fixation on those signs, it is said:

original: de la 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the procedure, etc.

original: rmi lam rnam par dpyod pa zhes pa ni rang bzhin med pa ste gtan la 'bebs pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rmi lam rnam par dpyod pa zhes pa ni rang bzhin med pa ste gtan la 'bebs pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The analysis of dreams is the absence of intrinsic nature, the gnosis of ascertainment.

original: 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pas na dam tshig gi snying po'o //
analyzed: 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pas na dam tshig gi snying po'o //
translated: The essence of the commitment is that which should not be transgressed.

original: rang gi sems ni brtags pa la //
analyzed: rang gi sems ni brtags pa la //
translated: In the examination of one's own mind

original: zhes pa ni rang gi kun gzhi la sogs pa'i sems ji ltar snang ba brtags pa la zhes so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rang gi kun gzhi la sogs pa'i sems ji ltar snang ba brtags pa la zhes so //
translated: means in the examination of one's own mind, such as the alaya, as it appears.

original: chos rnams thams cad rab tu gnas //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad rab tu gnas //
translated: All phenomena are well-established

original: zhes te de kho na khams gsum 'dus ma byas dang bcas par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: zhes te de kho na khams gsum 'dus ma byas dang bcas par gnas pa ste /
translated: Thus, reality is present in the three realms together with the unconditioned.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no subject-object dichotomy.

original: sa bcu pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: sa bcu pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And in the Sutra of the Ten Stages it is said:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag khams gsum pa dag ni sems tsam mo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag khams gsum pa dag ni sems tsam mo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “O sons of the Conqueror, the three realms are mind only.”

original: gang gzugs la sogs par snang ba ni rab rib can gyi zla ba dang / skra la sogs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: gang gzugs la sogs par snang ba ni rab rib can gyi zla ba dang / skra la sogs pa lta bu ste /
translated: That which appears as form and so forth is like the moon in the water, hair in the visual field, and so forth.

original: sgro btags pa'i don gyi rnam pa khams gsum gyi sems dang sems las byung ba ni sems su mi brdzun pa tsam du yod pa'o //
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i don gyi rnam pa khams gsum gyi sems dang sems las byung ba ni sems su mi brdzun pa tsam du yod pa'o //
translated: The aspect of the superimposed object is present in the three realms as mind and mental factors, but only as a mere falsity.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni //
translated: The imagination of what is unreal

original: sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa //
analyzed: sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa //
translated: Is mind and mental factors of the three realms.

original: zhes so // de bas na gnyis pos stong pa'i nam mkha' lta bu la chos thams cad gnas par 'gyur bar gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: zhes so // de bas na gnyis pos stong pa'i nam mkha' lta bu la chos thams cad gnas par 'gyur bar gsungs pa ni /
translated: Thus, it is said that all phenomena are present in a space-like voidness that is empty of duality.

original: nam mkha' rdo rje la gnas sems //
analyzed: nam mkha' rdo rje la gnas sems //
translated: Mind is present in the space of the vajra.

original: zhes so // de bas na kun du brtags pa'i bdag nyid can gyi chos med pas na de'i chos nyid kyang med pa'o zhes rnam par dpyad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes so // de bas na kun du brtags pa'i bdag nyid can gyi chos med pas na de'i chos nyid kyang med pa'o zhes rnam par dpyad pa'o //
translated: Thus, since there is no phenomenon that has the nature of the imagined, its reality also does not exist.

original: da ni de dag gsan pas bde bar @102a * //🔽gshegs pa kun ngo mtshar thob cing zhus pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni de dag gsan pas bde bar @102a * // gshegs pa kun ngo mtshar thob cing zhus pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, having heard that, the Sugata was amazed and spoke the reply.🔽The reply🔽Then, the Bhagavān, having heard that, was amazed and spoke this reply.🔽The reply

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The reply is indicated by the reply to the question.🔽The reply🔽The reply is indicated by the reply to the question.🔽The reply

original: rmi lam gyi mtshan ma thob pa'i ngo mtshar du gyur pa /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi mtshan ma thob pa'i ngo mtshar du gyur pa /
translated: The reply is indicated by the reply to the question.🔽The reply

original: de'i 'bras bu la rmad du gyur nas so //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu la rmad du gyur nas so //
translated: The reply is indicated by the reply to the question.🔽The reply🔽The reply is indicated by the reply to the question.🔽The reply

original: shes rab mchog tu gyur pa thob pas dris pa kun lung ston par nus pas na the tshom gcod pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab mchog tu gyur pa thob pas dris pa kun lung ston par nus pas na the tshom gcod pa'o //
translated: The reply is indicated by the reply to the question.

original: 'di ci lags zhes smras pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ci lags zhes smras pa'o //
translated: The reply

original: chos rnams ngo bo zhes pa la //
analyzed: chos rnams ngo bo zhes pa la //
translated: The reply is indicated by the reply to the question.🔽The reply🔽The reply is indicated by the reply to the question.🔽The reply

original: zhes pa ni brda la sogs pa'i tshul gyis brtags pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba la zhes pa'o //🔽chos kyi de nyid kun bshad pa //
analyzed: zhes pa ni brda la sogs pa'i tshul gyis brtags pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba la zhes pa'o //🔽chos kyi de nyid kun bshad pa //
translated: The reply is indicated by the reply to the question.🔽The reply🔽The reply is indicated by the reply to the question.🔽The reply🔽The reply is indicated by the reply to the question.

original: zhes pa ni zab mo dang yang dag par gsal ba'i ye shes kyi de kho na nyid bshad pa 'di ni ae ma'o ngo mtshar las byung ba'o zhes so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni zab mo dang yang dag par gsal ba'i ye shes kyi de kho na nyid bshad pa 'di ni ae ma'o ngo mtshar las byung ba'o zhes so //
translated: This is to say, this explanation of the reality of the wisdom of profound and perfect clarity is an “amazing wonder.”

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: nam mkha' la ni nam mkha' bsgom //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni nam mkha' bsgom //
translated: the space of space is meditated.

original: zhes te / gang de la blo 'jog pa rnams kyis ngo bo nyid med pa'i nam mkha' lta bu la dmigs su med pa'i ye shes nam mkha' lta bu sbyar nas bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: zhes te / gang de la blo 'jog pa rnams kyis ngo bo nyid med pa'i nam mkha' lta bu la dmigs su med pa'i ye shes nam mkha' lta bu sbyar nas bsgom pa'o //
translated: Those whose minds are set on that should meditate by applying the space-like wisdom, which is not an object of observation, to the space-like reality that is devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said,

original: 'phags pa byams pas kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pas kyang /
translated: the noble Maitreya also says,

original: 'di yi brtag pa dgag pa ste //🔽rang gi ngo bo bzlog pa min //
analyzed: 'di yi brtag pa dgag pa ste // rang gi ngo bo bzlog pa min //
translated: “The investigation of this is a negation,

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽da ni de'i lan le'u gnyis pa'i byang chub sems kyi ngo bo yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no // da ni de'i lan le'u gnyis pa'i byang chub sems kyi ngo bo yang gsungs pa /
translated: not the negation of its intrinsic reality.”

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o//
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o//
translated: Now, the reply to that is the second chapter, which also explains the reality of the mind of enlightenment.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces pa ni bos pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces pa ni bos pa ste /
translated: The Blessed One, all tathāgatas, is the vocative.

original: rnam grangs dang gnas skabs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs dang gnas skabs su shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as a synonym and a state.

original: nam mkha' ni chos gang dang yang ma bral ba ste zhes pa ni chos gang bems po la sogs pa'i tshul gyis snang ba yang nam mkha' dang ye shes gcig pas na'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni chos gang dang yang ma bral ba ste zhes pa ni chos gang bems po la sogs pa'i tshul gyis snang ba yang nam mkha' dang ye shes gcig pas na'o //
translated: Space is not devoid of any dharma whatsoever means that any dharma that appears in the manner of an inanimate object and so on is one with space and wisdom.

original: nam mkha' de chos thams cad dang bral ba zhes pa ni brtag pa'i bdag nyid can gyi chos nam mkha' la med pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' de chos thams cad dang bral ba zhes pa ni brtag pa'i bdag nyid can gyi chos nam mkha' la med pa'o //
translated: That space is devoid of all dharmas means that dharmas that have the nature of investigation do not exist in space.

original: nam mkha' steng ni chos thams cad ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' steng ni chos thams cad ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Space is all dharmas and so on.

original: gzung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yod pas na mi sems pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yod pas na mi sems pa'o //
translated: Since there is the concept of an object and so on, it is not the mind.

original: de bzhin du zhes pa nye bar 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes pa nye bar 'gro ba'o //
translated: Likewise means to approach.

original: rmi lam lta bu zhes pa ni 'dod pa'i 'bras bu rnyed pa'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu zhes pa ni 'dod pa'i 'bras bu rnyed pa'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: Like a dream means the sign of obtaining the desired result.

original: rmi lam 'dra ba las byung ba ni dngos grub chen po la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rmi lam 'dra ba las byung ba ni dngos grub chen po la sogs pa ste /
translated: Arising from a dream-like state is the great siddhi and so on.

original: nam mkha' ltar rig par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar rig par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: It should be known to be like space.

original: 'di lta ste zhes pa ni blo la @102b nye bar dgod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes pa ni blo la @102b nye bar dgod pa'o //
translated: Thus means to establish in the mind.

original: dper na zhes pa ni don nyid dper byas pa'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes pa ni don nyid dper byas pa'o //
translated: For example, is an example of the meaning itself.

original: nam mkha' la brtag tu med ces pa ni de mig la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang bral nas de skad do //
analyzed: nam mkha' la brtag tu med ces pa ni de mig la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang bral nas de skad do //
translated: In the sky, there is nothing to be examined, is said because it is free from the nature of the eyes, etc.

original: bltar mi snang ba zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bltar mi snang ba zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not visible, is because it is not the nature of form, etc.

original: de bzhin du zhes pa ni nges par song ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes pa ni nges par song ba'o //
translated: Likewise, is a definite conclusion.

original: chos thams cad kyang zhes pa ni rgyu ba dang gnas pa thams cad do //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang zhes pa ni rgyu ba dang gnas pa thams cad do //
translated: All phenomena, is all that moves and abides.

original: de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral bar rig par byas pas na nam mkha' lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral bar rig par byas pas na nam mkha' lta bu'o //
translated: It should be known in that way, is the sky-like nature of phenomena, because it is known to be free from apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: nam mkha' lta bu'i chos de yang ngo bo nyid gcig pas nyi tshe ba ma yin par gsungs pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bu'i chos de yang ngo bo nyid gcig pas nyi tshe ba ma yin par gsungs pa /
translated: That sky-like phenomenon is also not limited because of being of one nature.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavān, etc.

original: lus zhes pa ni gzugs can thams cad do //
analyzed: lus zhes pa ni gzugs can thams cad do //
translated: Body is all that is physical.

original: ngag ces pa ni sgra ji snyed pa'o //
analyzed: ngag ces pa ni sgra ji snyed pa'o //
translated: Speech is all sounds.

original: sems zhes pa ni bsam rtog ji snyed pa'o //
analyzed: sems zhes pa ni bsam rtog ji snyed pa'o //
translated: Mind is all thoughts and concepts.

original: chos thams cad kyi rjes su song ba zhes pa ni des chos thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rjes su song ba zhes pa ni des chos thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “It is the universal ground of all phenomena” means that it includes all phenomena.

original: de yang ngo bo nyid gcig pa ste /
analyzed: de yang ngo bo nyid gcig pa ste /
translated: It is also a single essence.

original: gong du gcig ce na /
analyzed: gong du gcig ce na /
translated: If you ask, “Is it one?”

original: sems kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes te /
analyzed: sems kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes te /
translated: It is the essence of mind.

original: thams cad kyang de'i rang bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyang de'i rang bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because everything is its nature.

original: dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las kyang /
analyzed: dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las kyang /
translated: The Sūtra Unraveling the Intention says:

original: phyi rol don rnams yod pa min //
analyzed: phyi rol don rnams yod pa min //
translated: External referents do not exist.

original: sna tshogs snang ba sems yin te //
analyzed: sna tshogs snang ba sems yin te //
translated: The variety of appearances is mind.

original: lus dang longs spyod gnas 'dra bar //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod gnas 'dra bar //
translated: The Buddha taught that the body, enjoyments, and abode

original: sems tsam du ni das bshad do //
analyzed: sems tsam du ni das bshad do //
translated: are only mind.🔽Space, earth, wind, sun,

original: nam mkha' sa rlung nyi ma dang // phyogs dang 'bab chu rgya mtsho rnams //
analyzed: nam mkha' sa rlung nyi ma dang // phyogs dang 'bab chu rgya mtsho rnams //
translated: directions, rivers, and oceans

original: nang gi yang dag byed pa yi //
analyzed: nang gi yang dag byed pa yi //
translated: are the inner

original: cha yin phyi rol 'dra bar gnas //
analyzed: cha yin phyi rol 'dra bar gnas //
translated: parts, appearing externally.🔽The all-base is the hands and feet,

original: kun gzhi kun du lag pa dang // kun gzhi kha mig mgo bo yin //
analyzed: kun gzhi kun du lag pa dang // kun gzhi kha mig mgo bo yin //
translated: the all-base is the mouth, eyes, and head.

original: ji ltar 'o ma gyur pa la //
analyzed: ji ltar 'o ma gyur pa la //
translated: Just as in milk

original: yon tan zho dang dar bar snang //
analyzed: yon tan zho dang dar bar snang //
translated: the qualities of yogurt and butter exist,

original: de bzhin kun gzhi'i rnams shes kyang //
analyzed: de bzhin kun gzhi'i rnams shes kyang //
translated: so it is with the consciousness of the all-base.

original: rnam par gyur nas gzugs ltar gnas //
analyzed: rnam par gyur nas gzugs ltar gnas //
translated: Having transformed, it abides like form.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: sems tsam de nyid kyang de bzhin nyid dang 'brel par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems tsam de nyid kyang de bzhin nyid dang 'brel par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that mind only is also connected with suchness,

original: lus dang ngag dang sems zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: it is said: “body, speech, and mind,” and so on.

original: gnyis su med do zhes pa ni mtha' gnyis dgag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis su med do zhes pa ni mtha' gnyis dgag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Nondual” is for the sake of refuting the two extremes.

original: sems can thams cad ces pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad ces pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “All sentient beings” are endowed with body, speech, and mind.

original: nam mkha' khams la gnas te zhes pa @103a * //
analyzed: nam mkha' khams la gnas te zhes pa @103a * //
translated: “Abiding in the space element”

original: ni de bzhin nyid la rnam par gnas pa ste de'i rang bzhin yin na zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ni de bzhin nyid la rnam par gnas pa ste de'i rang bzhin yin na zhes pa'o //
translated: means abiding in suchness, which is its nature.

original: de nyi tshe ba ma yin pas na nam mkha'i khams de yang zhes pa la sogs pa'i gang na yang mi gnas par mnyam pa nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de nyi tshe ba ma yin pas na nam mkha'i khams de yang zhes pa la sogs pa'i gang na yang mi gnas par mnyam pa nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: Since that is not limited, it is taught that “that space element also does not abide anywhere,” and so on, demonstrating its sameness.

original: mnyam pa nyid de nyid skye ba med do zhes te /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid de nyid skye ba med do zhes te /
translated: That sameness is unborn.

original: kun du brtags pa'i bdag nyid can skye ba med pa ste /
analyzed: kun du brtags pa'i bdag nyid can skye ba med pa ste /
translated: It is unborn, having the nature of the imagined.

original: skye ba yang gnyis su med pa'i tshul gyis 'byung ba kho na'o //
analyzed: skye ba yang gnyis su med pa'i tshul gyis 'byung ba kho na'o //
translated: And birth occurs only in a manner free from duality.

original: de bas na sems su gtogs pa thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa'o zhes te /
analyzed: de bas na sems su gtogs pa thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa'o zhes te /
translated: Therefore, all that is included in mind is essenceless.

original: ngo bo nying gzung ba dang 'dzin pa brtags pa'i tshul de dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nying gzung ba dang 'dzin pa brtags pa'i tshul de dang bral ba'o //
translated: The essence is free from the mode of the imagined object and subject.🔽And that is stated:

original: de yang / gzung dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ni /
analyzed: de yang / gzung dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ni /
translated: The aspects of object and subject

original: phyi yi mtshan nyid yod pa min //
analyzed: phyi yi mtshan nyid yod pa min //
translated: do not exist as external characteristics.

original: de bas mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de bas mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, because of the existence of characteristics,

original: dngos po rnam par bshad pa yin //🔽zhes so // ngo bo nyid med do zhes smos pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po rnam par bshad pa yin // zhes so // ngo bo nyid med do zhes smos pa ni /
translated: things are explained as being empty.

original: dngos por 'dzin pa bzlog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos por 'dzin pa bzlog pa'i phyir te /
translated: The statement “there is no essence” is for the purpose of countering the apprehension of things as being real.

original: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The nature of all phenomena is not existent.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bdag tu lta ba don gnyer dang // de la zhen pa dgag don du //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba don gnyer dang // de la zhen pa dgag don du //
translated: The view of self is for the purpose of engaging with objects,🔽and it is for the purpose of countering attachment to that.

original: rgyal ba rnams kyis stong par bstan //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyis stong par bstan //
translated: The victors taught it to be empty.

original: stong pa 'ba' zhig thabs yin na //
analyzed: stong pa 'ba' zhig thabs yin na //
translated: If emptiness alone were the method,

original: sangs rgyas nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: buddhahood would not occur.

original: zhes so // ngo bo nyid med pa'i chos de byang chub kyi sems yin par gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // ngo bo nyid med pa'i chos de byang chub kyi sems yin par gsungs pa /
translated: That reality without intrinsic reality is said to be the thought of enlightenment.

original: kye bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kye bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “O Bhagavat” and so on.

original: byang chub kyi sems ni zhes pa ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni zhes pa ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'o //
translated: The thought of enlightenment is the inseparability of emptiness and compassion.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes ni me long lta bu la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes ni me long lta bu la sogs pa ste /
translated: The pristine wisdom of all the Ones-Gone-Thus is the mirror-like pristine wisdom and so forth.

original: de 'byung bar byed pa'i rgyu ni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: de 'byung bar byed pa'i rgyu ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The cause of its arising is the thought of enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems de zhes pa la sogs pa yang gong ma ltar bshad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems de zhes pa la sogs pa yang gong ma ltar bshad do //
translated: The thought of enlightenment and so forth is explained as above.

original: rmi lam de ni zhes pa la sogs pa ni rmi lam dang gnyid ma log pa'i gnas skabs mtshungs par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam de ni zhes pa la sogs pa ni rmi lam dang gnyid ma log pa'i gnas skabs mtshungs par bstan pa yin no //
translated: “That dream” and so on teaches the similarity of the situation of dreaming and the situation of not being asleep.

original: khams gsum gyi bya ba de rnams zhes pa ni las sna tshogs pa las 'bras bu sna tshogs par snang ba'o //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi bya ba de rnams zhes pa ni las sna tshogs pa las 'bras bu sna tshogs par snang ba'o //
translated: “Those activities of the three realms” are the various appearances of effects from various kinds of actions.

original: de yang dus gsum snang ba ji snyed go rims bzhin du rmi lam ltar rig par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: de yang dus gsum snang ba ji snyed go rims bzhin du rmi lam ltar rig par bya'o zhes so //
translated: Moreover, the appearances of the three times should be known to be like a dream, in accordance with the order.

original: rmi lam dag bdag med pa'i gnas su zhes pa ni snang ba la ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: rmi lam dag bdag med pa'i gnas su zhes pa ni snang ba la ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
translated: As for “dreams are in a place without a self,” appearances are without an essence.

original: de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know them to be like that.

original: 'o na ngo bo nyid med @103b pas sems can gyi don ji ltar mdzad ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ngo bo nyid med @103b pas sems can gyi don ji ltar mdzad ce na /
translated: Well then, if they are without an essence, how do they perform the welfare of sentient beings?

original: mi rtog bzhin du mdzad pa'i dpe gsungs pa /
analyzed: mi rtog bzhin du mdzad pa'i dpe gsungs pa /
translated: The example of performing without conceptual thought is stated:

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavat, etc.

original: rin po che thams cad ces pa ni aindra n'i la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rin po che thams cad ces pa ni aindra n'i la sogs pa'o //
translated: “All jewels” are indranīla, etc.

original: de'i gtso bo ni yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa'o zhes so//
analyzed: de'i gtso bo ni yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa'o zhes so//
translated: The chief of those is endowed with all good qualities.

original: yon tan gang zhe na /
analyzed: yon tan gang zhe na /
translated: What are the good qualities?

original: rin po che thams cad kyi zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rin po che thams cad kyi zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is stated: “all jewels,” etc.

original: sems la gnas kyi zhes pa ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems la gnas kyi zhes pa ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Resides in the mind” means that it arises just as one wishes.

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu la ni ma yin no zhes pa ni rtag tu 'byung ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu la ni ma yin no zhes pa ni rtag tu 'byung ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the wish-fulfilling gem, because it is impossible for it to arise constantly.

original: chos thams cad ces pa ni phung po la sogs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: chos thams cad ces pa ni phung po la sogs pa thams cad do //
translated: All phenomena refers to all the aggregates and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ces pa ni stobs bcu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ces pa ni stobs bcu la sogs pa'o //
translated: All the qualities of a buddha refers to the ten powers and so forth.

original: rjes su rig par bya'o zhes pa ni rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ngo bo yin yang ji ltar btags pa de ltar snang bas na'o //
analyzed: rjes su rig par bya'o zhes pa ni rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ngo bo yin yang ji ltar btags pa de ltar snang bas na'o //
translated: They should be understood means that, although it is the nature free from all conceptual elaborations, it appears as it is imputed.

original: de la bde bar gshegs pa rnams ngo mtshar che ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la bde bar gshegs pa rnams ngo mtshar che ba gsungs pa /
translated: The Sugatas have declared the wonder🔽of the dharmas that follow after space,🔽the qualities of a buddha,🔽which follow after them, to be marvelous.

original: de las zhes pa la sogs pa nam mkha'i rjes su 'brang ba'i chos rnams la zhes pa ni nam mkha' khyab pa'i lus la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: de las zhes pa la sogs pa nam mkha'i rjes su 'brang ba'i chos rnams la zhes pa ni nam mkha' khyab pa'i lus la sogs pa la'o //
translated: The dharmas that follow after space refers to the body and so forth that pervade space.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zhes pa ni sku la sogs pa'i bkod pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zhes pa ni sku la sogs pa'i bkod pa'o //
translated: The qualities of a buddha refers to the array of the body and so forth.

original: rjes su 'brang ba zhes pa ni mngon par 'phel bar gyur pa ste ngo mtshar to zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba zhes pa ni mngon par 'phel bar gyur pa ste ngo mtshar to zhes pa'o //
translated: Following after them means increasing manifestly. It is marvelous.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad 'byung bar bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad 'byung bar bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the origin of all dharmas,

original: sngags kyi dngos grub 'byung ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: sngags kyi dngos grub 'byung ba gsungs pa /
translated: he teaches the origin of the magical power of the mantra.

original: des na sangs rgyas dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: des na sangs rgyas dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, “the Buddhas” and so forth.

original: sngags thams cad kyi dngos grub ni thun mong dang phyag rgya chen po'o //
analyzed: sngags thams cad kyi dngos grub ni thun mong dang phyag rgya chen po'o //
translated: The magical power of all mantras is the common and the great seal.

original: de gang la gnas zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: de gang la gnas zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: “In whom does it reside?” is the question.

original: lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: lan gsungs pa /
translated: The answer is stated:

original: de nas phyag na rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas phyag na rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Then Vajrapāṇi” and so forth.

original: legs so zhes pa ni dri ba'i skabs yin par mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: legs so zhes pa ni dri ba'i skabs yin par mkhyen pa'o //
translated: “Excellent” means knowing the occasion of the question.

original: dngos grub thams cad ni gong ma'o //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad ni gong ma'o //
translated: “All magical powers” are the above.

original: sngags thams cad ni bde bar gshegs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sngags thams cad ni bde bar gshegs pa rnams so //
translated: “All mantras” are the Sugatas.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs la dmigs so zhes pa ni de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas rtag tu mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs la dmigs so zhes pa ni de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas rtag tu mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “The focus on body, speech, and mind” is because of being their nature, since they are not always visible.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis zhus pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis zhus pa /
translated: The Tathāgatas ask:

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes so //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes so //
translated: “Why is that?”

original: bdag gi lus dang ngag dang sems rdo rje la gnas so zhes @104a * //
analyzed: bdag gi lus dang ngag dang sems rdo rje la gnas so zhes @104a * //
translated: It is said, It abides in the vajra of my body, speech, and mind,

original: pa ni sgo gsum las 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa ni sgo gsum las 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it increases from the three doors.

original: de'i ngo bo yang mnyam pa nyid du bstan pa yin pa'i phyir na lus dang zhes pa la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo yang mnyam pa nyid du bstan pa yin pa'i phyir na lus dang zhes pa la sogs pa smos so //
translated: And since its nature is taught to be sameness, it is said, body, etc.

original: gcig la gcig mi gnas par gsungs pa /
analyzed: gcig la gcig mi gnas par gsungs pa /
translated: It is said that it does not abide in each other.

original: sems de yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o//
analyzed: sems de yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o//
translated: It is said, That mind, etc.

original: yang dris pa /
analyzed: yang dris pa /
translated: Again it is asked,

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes so //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes so //
translated: Why is that?

original: lan du nam mkha' ni de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes te sgo gsum yang sems kyi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: lan du nam mkha' ni de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes te sgo gsum yang sems kyi ngo bo ste /
translated: The answer is, Because space is not its nature. The three doors are also the nature of mind.

original: de nyid nam mkha' lta bu ste /
analyzed: de nyid nam mkha' lta bu ste /
translated: That itself is like space.

original: nam mkha' ni phyogs gcig pa dgag pa ste rnam par khyab pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni phyogs gcig pa dgag pa ste rnam par khyab pa'o //
translated: Space is a negation of a single direction, and it pervades.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir zhus pa ;
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir zhus pa ;
translated: In order to teach that itself, it is asked,

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, etc.

original: lan gsungs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lan gsungs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The answer is given, The Bhagavān said, etc.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje la gnas so zhes pa ni de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje la gnas so zhes pa ni de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Abides in the vajra of body, speech, and mind means that is its very essence.

original: lus ngag dang sems las byung ngo zhes pa ni de rnams sbyangs pa la gnas pa'i ngo bo rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: lus ngag dang sems las byung ngo zhes pa ni de rnams sbyangs pa la gnas pa'i ngo bo rtogs pa ste /
translated: Arises from body, speech, and mind means that the essence of the purification of those is realization.

original: de nyid kyang sems so zhes grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyang sems so zhes grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: That very thing is mind is the conclusion.

original: sems gang na gnas zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: sems gang na gnas zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: Where does mind abide? is the question.

original: lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: lan gsungs pa /
translated: The answer is given:

original: nam mkha' la gnas so zhes de bzhin nyid la gnas pa bstan to //
analyzed: nam mkha' la gnas so zhes de bzhin nyid la gnas pa bstan to //
translated: Abides in space indicates abiding in suchness.

original: nam mkha' gang du gnas zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' gang du gnas zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: Where does space abide? is the question.

original: lan gsungs pa ;
analyzed: lan gsungs pa ;
translated: The answer is given:

original: gang na yang mi gnas so zhes pa ni dmigs su med par gyur ma thag tu rten dang brten pa por dmigs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang na yang mi gnas so zhes pa ni dmigs su med par gyur ma thag tu rten dang brten pa por dmigs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Abides nowhere means that as soon as it becomes unobservable, it is free from all observations of a support and something supported.

original: ngo mtshar du gyur pa ni byang chub kyi sems la'o //
analyzed: ngo mtshar du gyur pa ni byang chub kyi sems la'o //
translated: Wondrous is in regard to the thought of awakening.

original: rmad du gyur pa'i chos thams cad dang dngos grub thams cad la'o//
analyzed: rmad du gyur pa'i chos thams cad dang dngos grub thams cad la'o//
translated: Marvelous is in regard to all phenomena and all powers.

original: rang gi sems kyi chos nyid ces pa ni stong pa nyid de gzung ba la sogs pa'i bdag dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi sems kyi chos nyid ces pa ni stong pa nyid de gzung ba la sogs pa'i bdag dang bral ba'o //
translated: The reality of one's mind is emptiness, which is free from the self of the apprehended and so forth.

original: 'phags pa byams pas kyang /🔽gang zag dang ni chos rnams kyi //
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pas kyang / gang zag dang ni chos rnams kyi //
translated: The noble Maitreya also explains:🔽The emptiness of persons and phenomena

original: dngos po med 'dir stong pa nyid /🔽ces bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dngos po med 'dir stong pa nyid / ces bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: is the non-existence of things here.

original: de la gnas pa ni der ro gcig pa'o//
analyzed: de la gnas pa ni der ro gcig pa'o//
translated: Abiding in that is being of one taste with that.

original: de lta bu'i sems pa la smra brjod dang bral ba'i phyir cang mi smra bar 'khod par gyur to zhes so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sems pa la smra brjod dang bral ba'i phyir cang mi smra bar 'khod par gyur to zhes so //
translated: Since such a mind is free from speech and expression, they sat there in silence.

original: de rnams rang bzhin med pa las mi 'da' ba'i phyir sems kyi dam tshig go //
analyzed: de rnams rang bzhin med pa las mi 'da' ba'i phyir sems kyi dam tshig go //
translated: Since they do not go beyond the absence of intrinsic existence, it is the mind commitment.

original: de nyid rdo rje gsum gyi ngo bo bas na gsang ba'i rdo rje ste /
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje gsum gyi ngo bo bas na gsang ba'i rdo rje ste /
translated: Since that is the essence of the three vajras, it is the secret vajra.

original: de las phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa 'byung @104b ba'i phyir ro //🔽de ston par byed pa'i gzhung ni le'u ste bco lnga pa'o //
analyzed: de las phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa 'byung @104b ba'i phyir ro // de ston par byed pa'i gzhung ni le'u ste bco lnga pa'o //
translated: Since the great seal and so forth arise from that,🔽the chapter that teaches that is the fifteenth chapter.

original: le'u bco lnga pa'i 'grel ba'o /
analyzed: le'u bco lnga pa'i 'grel ba'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the fifteenth chapter.

original: // / bdag nyid dngos grub bsgrub pa dang slob ma dbang bskur ba'i don du /
analyzed: // / bdag nyid dngos grub bsgrub pa dang slob ma dbang bskur ba'i don du /
translated: For the sake of accomplishing the powers of the self and the consecration of the disciples,

original: ri mo bri ba'i phyir le'u bcu drug pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: ri mo bri ba'i phyir le'u bcu drug pa gsungs pa /
translated: the sixteenth chapter is taught for the sake of drawing the mandala.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, etc.

original: yang 'dus nas zhes pa ni le'u bzhi par gsungs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'dus nas zhes pa ni le'u bzhi par gsungs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: Again assembled is the procedure taught in chapter four.

original: rdo rje'i tshig gis zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rdo rje'i tshig gis zhes pa ni /
translated: With vajra words is with the words

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun zhi ba //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun zhi ba //
translated: All tathagatas are peaceful, etc.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig gis gsol ba btab nas so //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig gis gsol ba btab nas so //
translated: Having made the request,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: all tathagatas are the eternal, etc.

original: de'i rdo rje rin chen gyi mchod pa'i tshogs ni lha mo bcu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rdo rje rin chen gyi mchod pa'i tshogs ni lha mo bcu la sogs pa'o //
translated: His vajra jewel offering-host is the ten goddesses, etc.

original: mchod pa byas so zhes pa ni rang rang gi sa bon las spros pa mang du bkang bas na mchod pa'o //
analyzed: mchod pa byas so zhes pa ni rang rang gi sa bon las spros pa mang du bkang bas na mchod pa'o //
translated: Having made offerings is that they are offerings because they are filled with many emanations from their own seed syllables.

original: de nas sku'i dkyil 'khor gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nas sku'i dkyil 'khor gsungs pa /
translated: Then, the body mandala is taught:

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, etc.

original: rdo rje thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: rdo rje thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: All vajras are Vairochana.

original: de'i dkyil 'khor ni sku'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de'i dkyil 'khor ni sku'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: His mandala is the mandala of the body.

original: de nyid nyon mongs pa'i ri dags 'joms pa las mi 'da' bas na seng ge dam tshig go //
analyzed: de nyid nyon mongs pa'i ri dags 'joms pa las mi 'da' bas na seng ge dam tshig go //
translated: Since he does not go beyond the destruction of the deer of the afflictions, he is the lion of commitments.

original: de'i sngags pa mdzes par byed pas na rgyal po'o //
analyzed: de'i sngags pa mdzes par byed pas na rgyal po'o //
translated: Since he is the beautifier of the mantra practitioners, he is the king.

original: thugs rje'i rlan dang ldan pas na sprin no //
analyzed: thugs rje'i rlan dang ldan pas na sprin no //
translated: Since he is endowed with the moisture of compassion, he is the cloud.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mang po 'dus pas na bkod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mang po 'dus pas na bkod pa'o //
translated: Since many tathagatas gather there, it is the array.

original: dbyer mi phyed pas na rdo rje ste /
analyzed: dbyer mi phyed pas na rdo rje ste /
translated: Since it is indivisible, it is the vajra.

original: de lta bu'i me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi ting nge 'dzin la rnam par snang mdzad kyi tshul gyis snyoms par zhugs nas zhes so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi ting nge 'dzin la rnam par snang mdzad kyi tshul gyis snyoms par zhugs nas zhes so //
translated: Thus, having entered into the samadhi of mirror-like wisdom in the manner of Vairocana, he is said to have entered.

original: sku rdo rje ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: sku rdo rje ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The vajra body is Vairocana.

original: des 'khor los sgyur bas na 'khor lo da phyung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: des 'khor los sgyur bas na 'khor lo da phyung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Since he is the one who turns the wheel, he is the one who has turned the wheel.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pas sku'i dkyil 'khor bshad pa /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pas sku'i dkyil 'khor bshad pa /
translated: Then, etc. explains the mandala of the body.

original: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor ni rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor te da dang rab tu 'dra'o //
analyzed: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor ni rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor te da dang rab tu 'dra'o //
translated: The mandala of the mind is the natural mandala, which is similar to the previous one.

original: sku'i dkyil 'khor gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pas na dkyil 'khor rnams ni kun gyi mchog go //
analyzed: sku'i dkyil 'khor gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pas na dkyil 'khor rnams ni kun gyi mchog go //
translated: Since the mandala of the body is not common to others, it is the supreme of all mandalas.

original: de legs par rab tu bshad par bya //
analyzed: de legs par rab tu bshad par bya //
translated: I will explain that well.

original: zhes bshad par zhal gyis bzhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad par zhal gyis bzhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, he accepts the explanation.

original: stong pa nyid bcu drug gi rang bzhin gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnam par dag pas khru ni bcu drug tshad du byas te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid bcu drug gi rang bzhin gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnam par dag pas khru ni bcu drug tshad du byas te /
translated: The bodhisattvas, who are the nature of the sixteen emptinesses, are purified, and are sixteen cubits in size.

original: mdor na nges pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mdor na nges pa med pa'o //
translated: In brief, there is no certainty.

original: gru bzhi zhes pa ni mtshon pa tsam ste /
analyzed: gru bzhi zhes pa ni mtshon pa tsam ste /
translated: The square is merely an illustration.

original: @105a * // sgo bzhi dang rta babs bzhi la sogs pas rab tu mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: @105a * // sgo bzhi dang rta babs bzhi la sogs pas rab tu mdzes pa'o //
translated: It is very beautiful with four gates, four porticos, and so on.

original: dkyil 'khor de ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gnas pas na sangs rgyas thams cad dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor de ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gnas pas na sangs rgyas thams cad dkyil 'khor te /
translated: That mandala is the mandala of all buddhas, since it is the abode of all buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are the buddhas?

original: sku yi rdo rje rab tu gnas //
analyzed: sku yi rdo rje rab tu gnas //
translated: The vajra body is present.

original: zhes so // de'i nang du zhes pa ni cha brgyad pa'i grub bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: zhes so // de'i nang du zhes pa ni cha brgyad pa'i grub bzhi pa'o //
translated: The “inside” is the four parts of the eight-part [mandala].

original: 'khor lo ni zhes pa ni de'i phyed kyi 'khor lo'i phred ba'i zlum po ka ba brgyad kyi steng na bskor ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo ni zhes pa ni de'i phyed kyi 'khor lo'i phred ba'i zlum po ka ba brgyad kyi steng na bskor ba'o //
translated: The wheel is the circle of its half-wheel garland, revolving above the eight pillars.

original: rdo rje'i cho gas bri bar bya //
analyzed: rdo rje'i cho gas bri bar bya //
translated: One should draw with the vajra rite.

original: zhes pa ni 'dzab bzlas pa la sogs pa dbyer mi phyed pa'i cho ga rdzogs pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'dzab bzlas pa la sogs pa dbyer mi phyed pa'i cho ga rdzogs pas so //
translated: This is the rite of the complete indivisibility of the recitation of the mantra, etc.

original: phyag rgya dgod pa'i cho ga gsungs pa /
analyzed: phyag rgya dgod pa'i cho ga gsungs pa /
translated: The rite of arranging the seals is stated:

original: sngags rnams zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngags rnams zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The mantras, etc.

original: phyag na rdo rje zhes pa ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor la phyag na rdo rje dgod pa ste /
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje zhes pa ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor la phyag na rdo rje dgod pa ste /
translated: Vajrapāṇi is Vajrapāṇi in the mind mandala.

original: de'i gnas su bya zhes so //
analyzed: de'i gnas su bya zhes so //
translated: He should be placed in that place.

original: gang bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang bya zhe na /
translated: What should be done?

original: dbus su rnam par snang mdzad bri bar bya //
analyzed: dbus su rnam par snang mdzad bri bar bya //
translated: Vairocana should be drawn in the middle.

original: zhes pa ni dbus su zla ba'i gdan la 'khor lo dkar po rtsibs brgyad pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dbus su zla ba'i gdan la 'khor lo dkar po rtsibs brgyad pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: This is: in the middle, on a moon seat, an eight-spoked white wheel should be drawn.

original: mi bskyod pa zhes pa ni shar du nyi ma'i gdan la rdo rje srin po bri'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa zhes pa ni shar du nyi ma'i gdan la rdo rje srin po bri'o //
translated: Aksobhya is: in the east, on a sun seat, a vajra-rākṣasa should be drawn.

original: yang zhes pa'i sgras lho la sogs pa'i gnas su nyi ma'i gdan la rin po che la sogs pa bri bar bya zhes so //
analyzed: yang zhes pa'i sgras lho la sogs pa'i gnas su nyi ma'i gdan la rin po che la sogs pa bri bar bya zhes so //
translated: Also means that one should draw the jewel, etc. on the sun seat in the south, etc.

original: sku ni spyan ma'o //🔽gsung ni gos dkar mo'o //
analyzed: sku ni spyan ma'o // gsung ni gos dkar mo'o //
translated: The body is Locanā.🔽Speech is Māmakī.

original: thugs ni m'a ma k'i'o //
analyzed: thugs ni m'a ma k'i'o //
translated: Mind is Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: rdo rje mchog ni sgrol ma'o //
analyzed: rdo rje mchog ni sgrol ma'o //
translated: The supreme vajra is Tārā.

original: grva rnams kun du dgod par bya //
analyzed: grva rnams kun du dgod par bya //
translated: One should place them in all the corners.

original: zhes pa ni nang gi me mtshams la sogs pa bzhir zla ba'i gdan la spyan ma la sogs pa bzhi dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni nang gi me mtshams la sogs pa bzhir zla ba'i gdan la spyan ma la sogs pa bzhi dgod par bya'o //
translated: This means that one should place the four, Locanā, etc. on the moon seats in the inner southeast, etc.

original: stobs chen zhes pa ni lha chen po las khyad par du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: stobs chen zhes pa ni lha chen po las khyad par du gyur pa'o //
translated: Great strength means that they are superior to the great gods.

original: pha rol gnon pa'i zhes pa ni 'chi bdag gi bdud la sogs pa gnon par byed pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol gnon pa'i zhes pa ni 'chi bdag gi bdud la sogs pa gnon par byed pa'o //
translated: Subduing the enemy means that they subdue the demon of death, etc.

original: khro bo rnams kyang sgor bri'o //
analyzed: khro bo rnams kyang sgor bri'o //
translated: One should draw the wrathful ones at the gates.

original: zhes pa ni sgo bzhir nyi ma'i gdan la gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i mtshan ma thob pa la sogs pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sgo bzhir nyi ma'i gdan la gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i mtshan ma thob pa la sogs pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: This means that one should draw the signs of Yamāntaka, etc. on the sun seats at the four gates.

original: rdo rje gsang ba ni yi ge gsum mo //
analyzed: rdo rje gsang ba ni yi ge gsum mo //
translated: The secret vajra is the three syllables.

original: de las byung ba ni mchod pa ste /
analyzed: de las byung ba ni mchod pa ste /
translated: The offering is what arises from that.🔽

original: mchod pa'i rang bzhin gyi lha mo drug go //
analyzed: mchod pa'i rang bzhin gyi lha mo drug go //
translated: The offering that arises from that is the six goddesses who are the nature of offering.

original: de sngags shes pa yis phyi'i me mtshams la sogs pa'i grva bzhi dang 'jug pa'i sgo'i g-yas g-yon du me long la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dgod par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: de sngags shes pa yis phyi'i me mtshams la sogs pa'i grva bzhi dang 'jug pa'i sgo'i g-yas g-yon du me long la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dgod par bya'o zhes so //
translated: One who knows the mantra should place the signs of the mirror, etc., in the four corners beginning with the southeast and to the right and left of the entrance.

original: de ltar dkyil @105b 'khor bris pa 'di ni sngags rnams thams cad kyi 'da' bar mi bya bas na dam tshig shin tu 'da' dka'o zhes so //
analyzed: de ltar dkyil @105b 'khor bris pa 'di ni sngags rnams thams cad kyi 'da' bar mi bya bas na dam tshig shin tu 'da' dka'o zhes so //
translated: This drawing of the maṇḍala is the pledge that is difficult to transgress because it is not to be transgressed by all mantras.

original: bshad dang gci ba zhes pa la sogs pa ni thig dang rdul tshon dang / bza' ba'i dam tshig la sogs pa la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bshad dang gci ba zhes pa la sogs pa ni thig dang rdul tshon dang / bza' ba'i dam tshig la sogs pa la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The “urine and excrement” and so on are to be applied to the lines, colored powders, and pledges of food, and so on.

original: de'i don ni 'di lta ste dkyil 'khor bris nas rgyan dgod pa la sogs pa byas nas /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di lta ste dkyil 'khor bris nas rgyan dgod pa la sogs pa byas nas /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: Having drawn the maṇḍala and placed the ornaments, and so on,

original: skud pa dang tshon rtse gshegs su gsol la /
analyzed: skud pa dang tshon rtse gshegs su gsol la /
translated: the thread and colored powders are requested to depart.

original: btso blag mkhan gyi bu mo dang lhan cig tu sna tshogs padma ras kyis g-yogs pa'i gdan la 'dug ste /
analyzed: btso blag mkhan gyi bu mo dang lhan cig tu sna tshogs padma ras kyis g-yogs pa'i gdan la 'dug ste /
translated: One sits on a seat covered with a cloth of variegated lotus with a dyer’s daughter and

original: dam tshig gi 'khor lo dang gnyis su med pa'i 'khor lo la dkyil 'khor gzhan thim pas byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: dam tshig gi 'khor lo dang gnyis su med pa'i 'khor lo la dkyil 'khor gzhan thim pas byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: The wheel, which is nondual with the commitment wheel, is empowered by the dissolution of the other wheels into it.

original: de la bla na med pa'i mchod pa dang bstod pa dang / bshang gci la sogs pa'i bdud rtsi dang / me tog la sogs pa dang / bzlas pa dang 'byung po la gtor ma btang ba dang / h'um mdzad kyis lhag chad kyi skyon bsal nas phyag bya ba dang /
analyzed: de la bla na med pa'i mchod pa dang bstod pa dang / bshang gci la sogs pa'i bdud rtsi dang / me tog la sogs pa dang / bzlas pa dang 'byung po la gtor ma btang ba dang / h'um mdzad kyis lhag chad kyi skyon bsal nas phyag bya ba dang /
translated: Then, one should make the unexcelled offerings and praises to it, and the nectar of feces and urine, and so forth, and flowers, and so forth, and the recitation, and the bali offering to the elemental spirits, and the removal of the faults of excess and omission by Humkara, and the prostration.

original: sbyin sreg byas nas mnyes par byas nas rang nyid zhugs te lhas dbang bskur bar bsams nas slob ma bzhugs pa la sogs pa dang / bdag nyid dngos grub bsgrub par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: sbyin sreg byas nas mnyes par byas nas rang nyid zhugs te lhas dbang bskur bar bsams nas slob ma bzhugs pa la sogs pa dang / bdag nyid dngos grub bsgrub par bya'o zhes so //
translated: Having pleased it by performing the burnt offering, one should enter into it, and imagine that one is empowered by the deity, and then one should accomplish the powers for the sake of the disciples, and so forth, and for one's own sake.

original: gzhan rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should apply this procedure to the others as well.

original: cho ga 'di ni sngags rnams te /
analyzed: cho ga 'di ni sngags rnams te /
translated: This procedure is for the mantras.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi /
translated: Of all the Tathagatas,

original: sku'i rigs kyi sngags pa rnams kyis 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pas dam tshig go //
analyzed: sku'i rigs kyi sngags pa rnams kyis 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pas dam tshig go //
translated: Since the mantra adepts of the buddha-family should not transgress it, it is a pledge.

original: de ni sku rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor ro zhes mjug bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sku rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor ro zhes mjug bsdus pa'o //
translated: This is the maṇḍala of vajra body, the conclusion.

original: gsung gi dkyil 'khor bshad pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: gsung gi dkyil 'khor bshad pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to explain the maṇḍala of speech, [the Bhagavān] declares,

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Then,” and so on.

original: gsung rdo rje thams cad ni snang ba mtha' yas so //
analyzed: gsung rdo rje thams cad ni snang ba mtha' yas so //
translated: All vajra speech is Amitābha.

original: 'da' bar mi bya bas na dam tshig go //
analyzed: 'da' bar mi bya bas na dam tshig go //
translated: Since it should not be transgressed, it is a pledge.

original: sprin bkod pa rdo rje ni gong ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sprin bkod pa rdo rje ni gong ma bzhin no //
translated: The vajra cloud array is as before.

original: de lta bu'i so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes kyi ting nge 'dzin la /
analyzed: de lta bu'i so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes kyi ting nge 'dzin la /
translated: In that way, the samādhi of discerning wisdom,

original: snang ba mtha' yas kyi tshul du snyoms par zhugs nas zhes so //
analyzed: snang ba mtha' yas kyi tshul du snyoms par zhugs nas zhes so //
translated: having entered into union in the manner of Amitābha,

original: gsung rdo rje ni snang ba mtha' yas so //
analyzed: gsung rdo rje ni snang ba mtha' yas so //
translated: vajra speech is Amitābha.

original: des 'khor los sgyur bas na dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: des 'khor los sgyur bas na dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Since it is turned by him, it is a maṇḍala.

original: de phyung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de phyung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It was emitted is to be supplied.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pas de nyid bshad pa ste gong ma ltar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pas de nyid bshad pa ste gong ma ltar sbyar ro //
translated: Then, and so on, explains that, to be supplied as before.

original: sems ma rdo rje ma @106a * //
analyzed: sems ma rdo rje ma @106a * //
translated: and the mind is Vajra-dharminī.

original: la sogs pa dag pa'i phyir khru nyi shu'i tshad du bya'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa dag pa'i phyir khru nyi shu'i tshad du bya'o //
translated: In order to purify these, one should make the mandala twenty cubits in size.

original: gru bzhi lham pa zhes pa ni dbus so //
analyzed: gru bzhi lham pa zhes pa ni dbus so //
translated: “Square” means in the center.

original: cho ga bzhin zhes pa ni gong ma ltar dbyer med pa'i cho gas rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: cho ga bzhin zhes pa ni gong ma ltar dbyer med pa'i cho gas rdzogs pa'o //
translated: “According to the rite” means that it is completed by the rite of indivisibility as above.

original: gru bzhi ni tshon gyi ra ba dgug pa'o //
analyzed: gru bzhi ni tshon gyi ra ba dgug pa'o //
translated: “Square” means that the boundary of the colors is drawn.

original: sgo bzhi pa ni gru bzhi pa'i brgyad ca'o //
analyzed: sgo bzhi pa ni gru bzhi pa'i brgyad ca'o //
translated: “With four doors” means that the four corners are marked.

original: rdo rje bsgoms pa zhes pa ni 'od dpag tu med pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad du bsgoms pa'i slob dpon dang slob ma'i ngo bos srad bu bre ba dang thig gdab par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: rdo rje bsgoms pa zhes pa ni 'od dpag tu med pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad du bsgoms pa'i slob dpon dang slob ma'i ngo bos srad bu bre ba dang thig gdab par bya'o zhes so //
translated: “Contemplating the vajra” means that the master and the disciple, contemplating Amitābha and Vairocana, should draw the lines and lay out the mandala.

original: nyid kyi sku'i dkyil 'khor gnas //
analyzed: nyid kyi sku'i dkyil 'khor gnas //
translated: The mandala of his body is located🔽in the center of the mandala of the vajra realm.

original: zhes pa ni snang ba mtha' yas nyid gzugs dang ldan pa ni sku'i dkyil 'khor yin yang 'dod chags rnam par dag pa'i dbang gis ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni snang ba mtha' yas nyid gzugs dang ldan pa ni sku'i dkyil 'khor yin yang 'dod chags rnam par dag pa'i dbang gis ni /
translated: The mandala of Amitābha’s body, endowed with form, is the mandala of the body. However, by the power of the purification of passion,

original: rdo rje gsung gi yon tan bskyed //
analyzed: rdo rje gsung gi yon tan bskyed //
translated: the qualities of vajra speech are generated.

original: ces pa'o // rgyal po chen po rdo rje chos ni snang ba mtha' yas so //
analyzed: ces pa'o // rgyal po chen po rdo rje chos ni snang ba mtha' yas so //
translated: The great king Vajradharma is Amitābha.

original: de nyid gos dkar mo'i bdag po bas na rig pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: de nyid gos dkar mo'i bdag po bas na rig pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: Since he is the lord of Pāṇḍaravāsinī, he is the lord of knowledge.

original: de dbab par bya ba ni cho ga'i gnas skabs thams cad du bdag gi lus ngag yid gsum la bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: de dbab par bya ba ni cho ga'i gnas skabs thams cad du bdag gi lus ngag yid gsum la bsgom pa'o //
translated: He is to be brought down, meditated upon in one’s own body, speech, and mind, in all the situations of the rite.

original: de'i dbus su zhes pa ni gru bzhi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su zhes pa ni gru bzhi la sogs pa'o //
translated: In its center means in the four-cornered, etc.

original: rdo rje zlum po kun du bri bar bya //
analyzed: rdo rje zlum po kun du bri bar bya //
translated: The vajra circle is to be drawn all around.

original: zhes pa ni dbyer med pa'i padma'i phreng bas bskor ba ka ba brgyad kyi steng du bri bar bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dbyer med pa'i padma'i phreng bas bskor ba ka ba brgyad kyi steng du bri bar bya'o zhes so //
translated: The indivisible lotus garland is to be drawn on top of the eight pillars.

original: phyag rgya dgod pa'i cho ga gsungs pa /
analyzed: phyag rgya dgod pa'i cho ga gsungs pa /
translated: The procedure for placing the seals is stated:

original: mdo ru zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mdo ru zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: In brief, etc.

original: cho ga bzhin du zhes pa ni de nyid 'dus pa la sogs pa'i las kyi cho ga mthong bas so //
analyzed: cho ga bzhin du zhes pa ni de nyid 'dus pa la sogs pa'i las kyi cho ga mthong bas so //
translated: According to the rite means according to the rite of the performance of the rite of the Gathering of the Essential, etc.

original: tshe dpag med kyi phyag rgya che //
analyzed: tshe dpag med kyi phyag rgya che //
translated: The great seal of Amitāyus.

original: zhes pa ni padma dmar po 'dab ma brgyad pa nyi ma'i gdan la gnas pa de'i dbus su gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni padma dmar po 'dab ma brgyad pa nyi ma'i gdan la gnas pa de'i dbus su gzhag par bya'o //
translated: This is a red lotus with eight petals, situated on a sun seat.

original: rdo rje zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: Vajra means Akṣobhya.

original: gnas mchog de nyid du zhes pa ni snang ba mtha' yas kyi gnas su mi bskyod pa'i rdo rje dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas mchog de nyid du zhes pa ni snang ba mtha' yas kyi gnas su mi bskyod pa'i rdo rje dgod par bya'o //
translated: In that very supreme place means that in the place of Amitābha, the vajra of Akṣobhya is to be placed.

original: lhag ma ji lta ba bzhin du dgod pa'i phyir na thams cad yongs su dgod par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: lhag ma ji lta ba bzhin du dgod pa'i phyir na thams cad yongs su dgod par bya'o zhes so //
translated: In order to place the rest as they are, all are to be placed.

original: yongs su gsang ba'i cho ga bzhin //
analyzed: yongs su gsang ba'i cho ga bzhin //
translated: As for the secret worship,

original: zhes pa la cho ga 'di yin te /
analyzed: zhes pa la cho ga 'di yin te /
translated: this is the rite.

original: gong ma ltar gar mkhan gyi bu mo dang ldan par dam tshig gi 'khor lo dang gnyis su med par byas nas dkyil 'khor gzhan bkug pas dkyil 'khor dam pa ste /
analyzed: gong ma ltar gar mkhan gyi bu mo dang ldan par dam tshig gi 'khor lo dang gnyis su med par byas nas dkyil 'khor gzhan bkug pas dkyil 'khor dam pa ste /
translated: As above, having united with the dancer’s daughter, having made the pledge wheel nondual, having summoned the other maṇḍala, the supreme maṇḍala

original: sngon bas lhag par gnas par byas nas so //
analyzed: sngon bas lhag par gnas par byas nas so //
translated: is made to abide as before, and more.

original: de nas gsang pa'i mchod bya ba //
analyzed: de nas gsang pa'i mchod bya ba //
translated: Then, the secret worship is performed.

original: @106b zhes pa ni gar mkhan gyi bu mo'i gnas las lha mo bcu'i gzugs spros pa thim pas rdo rje can dag mnyes zhes so //
analyzed: @106b zhes pa ni gar mkhan gyi bu mo'i gnas las lha mo bcu'i gzugs spros pa thim pas rdo rje can dag mnyes zhes so //
translated: This is the dissolution of the emanation of the forms of the ten goddesses from the abode of the dancer’s daughter, and so “the vajra-holders are pleased.”

original: de bzhin du bstod pa byas nas bshang gci'i khu ba'i dam tshig gis mchod nas zhes te rlung la sogs pa'i rim pas sbyangs pa'i rim pas bdud rtsi'i 'khor lo tshim par byas nas gang 'dod pa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur zhes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bstod pa byas nas bshang gci'i khu ba'i dam tshig gis mchod nas zhes te rlung la sogs pa'i rim pas sbyangs pa'i rim pas bdud rtsi'i 'khor lo tshim par byas nas gang 'dod pa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur zhes so //
translated: Having thus praised, one should worship with the pledge of feces and urine, and so on, and by the process of the stage of purification, one should satisfy the wheel of elixir, and one will obtain whatever power one desires.

original: gzhan gong ma bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gong ma bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be understood as above.

original: cho ga 'di ni gsung gi rigs kyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dam tshig 'da' bar dka' ba'o zhes so //
analyzed: cho ga 'di ni gsung gi rigs kyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dam tshig 'da' bar dka' ba'o zhes so //
translated: This rite is the pledge of all the buddha-families of awakened speech, which is difficult to transgress.

original: da ni gsung gi dkyil 'khor ro zhes mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: da ni gsung gi dkyil 'khor ro zhes mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: Now, the summary of the maṇḍala of awakened speech:

original: da ni lha'i 'khor lo dang ldan pa gzhan gyi dkyil 'khor yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni lha'i 'khor lo dang ldan pa gzhan gyi dkyil 'khor yang gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the maṇḍala of others endowed with the wheel of deities is also stated:

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Then,” and so on.
